column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=wBI%2FKKnYWz%2FgpEHCLyZC7A%3D%3D&trackingId=PL1IvD7gKZku0Je2pARtDg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didn’t stop us from becoming a unicorn 🦄 We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it ♥

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapay’s key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
You’ll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
You’re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000€ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapay’s values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English 😉
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating but… we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=wBI%2FKKnYWz%2FgpEHCLyZC7A%3D%3D&trackingId=9PlXezLJ6e4MWgdyNRjrng%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You’ll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We’re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We’re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they’re looking for in their local communities – whether it’s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You’ll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito’s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it’s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‘Work from anywhere’ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a €8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4131807238,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/stage-data-analyst-milano-at-cpm-italy-4131807238?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=wBI%2FKKnYWz%2FgpEHCLyZC7A%3D%3D&trackingId=vIdcdFirz7AhYsEI8%2F%2F89A%3D%3D,Stage Data Analyst | MILANO,CPM Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.
Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!
Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.

Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.

Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.
Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?
La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale. In particolare ti insegneremo a:
verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser
analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri
valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI)
preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.
Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.
Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.
hai la passione per i numeri
te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici
Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.
La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

4148274143,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4148274143?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=JnkgKRoo5ft8iVIZ%2BIFFoA%3D%3D&trackingId=ozopHoQeVgvu4%2F2QU4KXmQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Power BI,LACO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.

LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.

At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.
As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:
Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.
You get even more bonus points if …
You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …
Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.


LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data &
column2:
AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.


At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
  • Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
  • Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have an analytical mindset.
  • You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
  • You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
  • You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
  • You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.


You get even more bonus points if …

  • You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
  • You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
  • You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER

  • We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
  • Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
  • A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …


Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

If you’re ready to take initiative, contribute to impactful projects, and join a team that values collaboration and innovation, we’re eager to meet you. Apply now and be part of a company where your well-being and professional growth are top priorities.

We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our dynamic and solution-oriented team. In this role, you will be the crucial link between the business and operational services, supporting key departments such as sales, claims, underwriting, and product development. Variety will be your daily reality, with opportunities to contribute across diverse areas like implementing AI solutions, supporting pricing strategies, and providing actionable insights.


What Will You Do?

You will:

  • Support the business by answering complex quantitative questions and delivering clear, actionable insights.
  • Monitor and analyze product portfolios to identify trends and improvement opportunities.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to support product development and pricing exercises.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance performance across departments.
  • Coach and train colleagues to strengthen their analytical capabilities.


Your Strengths

We’re looking for someone who:

  • Is fluent in English and has a strong knowledge of Dutch or French, with a good understanding of the other language.
  • Knowledge of Qlik or similar data visualization tools.
  • Has advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel, with little left to learn in the tool.
  • Holds a degree in fields like Business Administration, Business Economics, Business Engineering, or an equivalent qualification through experience.
  • Has a passion for numbers and the ability to explain complex analyses to non-experts.
  • Tackles challenges proactively and learns from every experience.
  • Combines pragmatism, openness to feedback, and a critical yet positive mindset.
  • Can work independently but thrives in a team-oriented, self-steered environment.


Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in insurance.
  • An interest in AI, machine learning, or advanced analytics techniques.


What We Offer

  • A varied and dynamic role within a supportive team.
  • A modern workspace with flexible working arrangements, including remote work options.
  • A full-time, permanent contract with competitive compensation and fringe benefits.
  • Additional vacation days to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning and personal development.


If you’re ready to take initiative, contribute to impactful projects, and join a team that values collaboration and innovation, we’re eager to meet you. Apply now and be part of a company where your well-being and professional growth are top priorities.

During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.
We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

Our consulting client is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Brussels.


Experience in the Insurance industry is mandatory.


The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.


During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.


Responsibilities:


  • Data Collection and Processing
  • Data Analysis
  • Data Visualization
  • Reporting and Presentation
  • Data-Driven Decision Making
  • Continuous Improvement and Learning


Your Skills:


  • We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
  • You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
  • Tableau/Power BI, matplotlib
  • BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

The Data Analyst Intern will assist the Business Intelligence team in creating data visualizations and interactive reports for Chanel in the Swiss Markets. Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field

Ability to work in a team and communicate effectively
Proactive and eager to learn and contribute to the team

Job Profile

Garantir la maîtrise des structures de données et gérer la qualité et les risques tout au long de leur cycle de vie

S’assurer du respect et de l'adaptation des démarches mises en œuvre

Faciliter la compréhension et l'exploitation de la valeur des données, assurer leur gestion et utilisation, et clarifier leur description, documentation et modélisation métier
Contribuer à définir les règles d'accessibilité, de sécurité, de conformité et de confidentialité
Diplôme universitaire idéalement dans la gestion de données

Connaissances logiciels : Power-BI, Tableau, SAP, Créo
Connaissances des pratiques du métier d’Industrialisation et du PLM
Compétences en analyse de données, facilité à s'approprier un domaine de data
Bon esprit de synthèse, sens de la communication
Capacité à travailler en équipe et d'animer un groupe multisite de Key-user

🔥 Job description


Pour notre division Production, nous recherchons un Data Analyst PLM (H/F).


🎯 GENERAL DUTIES


  • Mise en œuvre et ajustement de la stratégie de la démarche ADE (Animation Data Excellence) grâce à une connaissance développée de la collecte, de la conservation et de l’interprétation des données
  • Garantir la maîtrise des structures de données et gérer la qualité et les risques tout au long de leur cycle de vie
  • Mise en place et maintien de la structure organisationnelle conforme aux prérogatives de la démarche ADE
  • S’assurer du respect et de l'adaptation des démarches mises en œuvre
  • Superviser la qualité, la fiabilité et l'accessibilité des données de son Data Domain
  • Faciliter la compréhension et l'exploitation de la valeur des données, assurer leur gestion et utilisation, et clarifier leur description, documentation et modélisation métier
  • Contribuer à définir les règles d'accessibilité, de sécurité, de conformité et de confidentialité


📃 QUALIFICATIONS:


  • Diplôme universitaire idéalement dans la gestion de données
  • Expérience en business analyse et en data analyse, avec idéalement une part d'animation de groupe de Key-user
  • Connaissances logiciels : Power-BI, Tableau, SAP, Créo
  • Connaissances des pratiques du métier d’Industrialisation et du PLM
  • Compétences en analyse de données, facilité à s'approprier un domaine de data
  • Bon esprit de synthèse, sens de la communication
  • Autonomie, sens du service, rigueur
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et d'animer un groupe multisite de Key-user

4132425313,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-risorse-professional-4132425313?position=3&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=3ht7TMElG16C7RQn0fBdtw%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Risorse Professional,"Lugano, Ticino, Switzerland","Risorse Professional, realtà specializzata nella Ricerca e Selezione di profili Middle e Senior Management, per storica azienda Cliente, con sede in Svizzera, che opera nel settore degli operatori marittimi/ logistici e che gestisce una moderna flotta di oltre 100 navi, offrendo soluzioni logistiche innovative efficienti e sostenibili su scala globale, ricerca una figura di:

che si occuperà di gestire con attenzione i processi di inserimento, analisi e rappresentazione dati. Il candidato ideale deve avere una forte attenzione ai dettagli, competenze nell'uso di software specifici e capacità di adattamento al volume di dati variabile del settore marittimo.
•Esperienza in ruoli simili di inserimento dati o gestione di database, preferibilmente in contesti marittimi o logistici.
•Conoscenza e familiarità con il software IMOS (o disponibilità ad apprenderne l'uso).
•Ottime conoscenze del programma Power BI per analisi e rappresentazione dei dati.
•Capacità di lavorare in team e interagire efficacemente con diversi dipartimenti.

•Inserimento dati: seguire le procedure e le linee guida aziendali per garantire la precisione nell'inserimento dei dati nel software IMOS, incluse le descrizioni delle navi, i profili completi delle società clienti o fornitori e i contratti di time charter.

•Collaborazione interdipartimentale: lavorare a stretto contatto con i dipartimenti di Chartering e Operations per assicurare che i dati vengano inseriti in modo tempestivo, considerando che il volume può variare di giorno in giorno.

•Analisi e rappresentazione dati con Power BI: creare report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati aziendali in modo chiaro e funzionale, supportando i dipartimenti di Chartering e Operations nelle decisioni operative.
•Verifica e controllo: controllare che i dati rispettino i requisiti aziendali prima dell'inserimento in IMOS, assicurando che tutte le informazioni siano complete e accurate.
•Riservatezza e sicurezza: mantenere l'integrità e la riservatezza dei dati, rispettando i protocolli aziendali.
•Impegno lavorativo: posizione a tempo pieno con presenza al 100% in sede.
•Pacchetto retributivo: salario competitivo, commisurato all'esperienza e alle competenze, con possibilità di bonus aziendali basati sulle performance.
•Ambiente professionale: un contesto di lavoro stimolante e dinamico all'interno di un team internazionale.
•Crescita e sviluppo: opportunità di sviluppo professionale e formazione continua.

Risorse Professional, realtà specializzata nella Ricerca e Selezione di profili Middle e Senior Management, per storica azienda Cliente, con sede in Svizzera, che opera nel settore degli operatori marittimi/ logistici e che gestisce una moderna flotta di oltre 100 navi, offrendo soluzioni logistiche innovative efficienti e sostenibili su scala globale, ricerca una figura di:


Data Analyst


che si occuperà di gestire con attenzione i processi di inserimento, analisi e rappresentazione dati. Il candidato ideale deve avere una forte attenzione ai dettagli, competenze nell'uso di software specifici e capacità di adattamento al volume di dati variabile del settore marittimo.


Requisiti


•Esperienza in ruoli simili di inserimento dati o gestione di database, preferibilmente in contesti marittimi o logistici.

•Conoscenza e familiarità con il software IMOS (o disponibilità ad apprenderne l'uso).

•Ottime conoscenze del programma Power BI per analisi e rappresentazione dei dati.

•Elevata attenzione ai dettagli e precisione.

•Capacità di lavorare in team e interagire efficacemente con diversi dipartimenti.

•Conoscenza dell’inglese, sia scritto che parlato.


Attività:


•Inserimento dati: seguire le procedure e le linee guida aziendali per garantire la precisione nell'inserimento dei dati nel software IMOS, incluse le descrizioni delle navi, i profili completi delle società clienti o fornitori e i contratti di time charter.

•Collaborazione interdipartimentale: lavorare a stretto contatto con i dipartimenti di Chartering e Operations per assicurare che i dati vengano inseriti in modo tempestivo, considerando che il volume può variare di giorno in giorno.

•Analisi e rappresentazione dati con Power BI: creare report e dashboard per visualizzare i dati aziendali in modo chiaro e funzionale, supportando i dipartimenti di Chartering e Operations nelle decisioni operative.

•Verifica e controllo: controllare che i dati rispettino i requisiti aziendali prima dell'inserimento in IMOS, assicurando che tutte le informazioni siano complete e accurate.

•Riservatezza e sicurezza: mantenere l'integrità e la riservatezza dei dati, rispettando i protocolli aziendali.


Altre informazioni

•Impegno lavorativo: posizione a tempo pieno con presenza al 100% in sede.

•Pacchetto retributivo: salario competitivo, commisurato all'esperienza e alle competenze, con possibilità di bonus aziendali basati sulle performance.

•Ambiente professionale: un contesto di lavoro stimolante e dinamico all'interno di un team internazionale.

•Crescita e sviluppo: opportunità di sviluppo professionale e formazione continua.

•Sede di lavoro: Lugano, Svizzera.

4142347359,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-tableau-f-h-at-qim-info-4142347359?position=4&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=hAOGsw060Ppo3AHsyu6s%2FA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Tableau (F/H),Qim info,"Geneva, Switzerland","📣 Qim info, qui sommes-nous ?
Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004 et implantée en Suisse (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich & Bâle) et en France (Annecy, Lyon & Paris).

Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un Système d’Information sur différents métiers (Etudes & Développement, Fonctionnel, Infrastructures & Réseaux, Data, DevOps ...) mais aussi différents secteurs d’activités (Banque, Finance, Assurance, Luxe, Retail, Aéronautique ...).
Avec plus de 600 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents !
Qim info obtient une note globale de 4.1/5 sur Glassdoor et se place en 3ème position du classement ICTJournal en 2023.
Nous recrutons actuellement un Data Analyst expert sur TABLEAU F/H en CDI pour accompagner les équipes de notre client dans la mise en place de nouveaux projets.
Dans le cadre de ces activités, vous intégrez les équipes de nos clients afin de participer au projet de migration et installation de Tableau.
Plus précisément, vous serez en charge de plusieurs sujets :
S'assurer que les connecteurs de données sont compatibles avec l'infrastructure Linux
Maintenir et améliorer les performances de Tableau
Veiller à l'intégrité des données et des rapports après chaque étape de migration
S'assurer que toutes les règles de sécurité des données et protocoles d'accès sont maintenus
Elaborer des processus et de la documentation détaillée pour toutes les étapes de la migration
Accompagner les équipes internes pendant et après la migration pour assurer la montée en compétence
Assurer un support continu pour résoudre les problèmes post-migration
Expérience de 10 ans sur un poste similaire.
Compétence en gestion des bases de données et connecteurs de données
Vous êtes doté d'un très bon sens du relationnel et vous savez être force de proposition
If you don't speak english do not apply, thank you !
Vous êtes capable de prendre en main rapidement des sujets techniques, êtes autonome, rigoureux(euse) et méthodique ?
Ce poste est fait pour vous !
TT : 2 jours de télétravail par semaine 💻

Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est votre premier point de contact. A votre écoute, leur métier est de comprendre votre parcours, et de tenir compte de votre projet de vie et de vos attentes afin de vous proposer des missions qui vous correspondent.
Selon votre domaine d’expertise, nous vous proposons d’échanger et de parler technique avec l’un de nos collaborateurs.

Contexte, constitution de l’équipe en place, objectifs, expertise technique demandée, challenges à relever : cet entretien avec un Business Manager vous permet de connaître en détail les missions ou projets sur lesquels nous pourrions être amenés à travailler ensemble.
Un nouveau challenge au poste qui vous correspond !
🛠 Une expertise reconnue dans le monde du conseil avec une activité tournée autour d’une dizaine de secteurs d’activités et une connaissance de l’ensemble des métiers de l’IT.
🤜🤛 Une proximité et un suivi RH & managérial de qualité avec nos consultants pour les accompagner dans leur montée en compétences et dans leur mission au quotidien.

🥳 Nous rejoindre, c’est aussi partager plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim techs talks, soirées d’entreprises... De nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année, de quoi se créer de beaux souvenirs ensemble !
Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature 😊

Les informations que vous fournissez au cours de la procédure de candidature seront utilisées conformément à la politique de confidentialité de Qim info. En soumettant votre candidature, vous reconnaissez et acceptez les conditions énoncées dans cette déclaration de confidentialité.

Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un Système d’Information sur différents métiers (Etudes &
column5:
Réseaux, Data, DevOps ...) mais aussi différents secteurs d’activités (Banque, Finance, Assurance, Luxe, Retail, Aéronautique ...).

Avec plus de 600 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents !

Qim info obtient une note globale de 4.1/5 sur Glassdoor et se place en 3ème position du classement ICTJournal en 2023.



📌 En quelques mots

Nous recrutons actuellement un Data Analyst expert sur TABLEAU F/H en CDI pour accompagner les équipes de notre client dans la mise en place de nouveaux projets.


🎯Votre mission

Dans le cadre de ces activités, vous intégrez les équipes de nos clients afin de participer au projet de migration et installation de Tableau.


📝 Description des activités :

Plus précisément, vous serez en charge de plusieurs sujets :

  • Définir le protocole de migration
  • S'assurer que les connecteurs de données sont compatibles avec l'infrastructure Linux
column6:
• Maintenir et améliorer les performances de Tableau
  • Veiller à l'intégrité des données et des rapports après chaque étape de migration
column7: • S'assurer que toutes les règles de sécurité des données et protocoles d'accès sont maintenus
column8:
• Elaborer des processus et de la documentation détaillée pour toutes les étapes de la migration
  • Accompagner les équipes internes pendant et après la migration pour assurer la montée en compétence
  • Assurer un support continu pour résoudre les problèmes post-migration


    • 💼 Votre profil

    • Expérience de 10 ans sur un poste similaire.
    • Expert Tableau Server et Desktop
    • Bonne compréhension des infrastructures Linux
    • Compétence en gestion des bases de données et connecteurs de données
    • Vous êtes doté d'un très bon sens du relationnel et vous savez être force de proposition
    • If you don't speak english do not apply, thank you !


    Vous êtes capable de prendre en main rapidement des sujets techniques, êtes autonome, rigoureux(euse) et méthodique ?


    Ce poste est fait pour vous !


    Concepts à maitriser : Organisation Agile



    🏆 Conditions du poste


    • Genève📍
    • Contrat CDI 📄
    • TT : 2 jours de télétravail par semaine 💻
    • Démarrage dès que possible 📆


    💥Les étapes pour nous rencontrer

    • Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est votre premier point de contact. A votre écoute, leur métier est de comprendre votre parcours, et de tenir compte de votre projet de vie et de vos attentes afin de vous proposer des missions qui vous correspondent.
    • Selon votre domaine d’expertise, nous vous proposons d’échanger et de parler technique avec l’un de nos collaborateurs.
    • Contexte, constitution de l’équipe en place, objectifs, expertise technique demandée, challenges à relever : cet entretien avec un Business Manager vous permet de connaître en détail les missions ou projets sur lesquels nous pourrions être amenés à travailler ensemble.
    • Un nouveau challenge au poste qui vous correspond !



    🙌 Pourquoi choisir Qim info ?


    🛠 Une expertise reconnue dans le monde du conseil avec une activité tournée autour d’une dizaine de secteurs d’activités et une connaissance de l’ensemble des métiers de l’IT.


    🤜🤛 Une proximité et un suivi RH &
column9:
managérial de qualité avec nos consultants pour les accompagner dans leur montée en compétences et dans leur mission au quotidien.


🥳 Nous rejoindre, c’est aussi partager plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim techs talks, soirées d’entreprises... De nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année, de quoi se créer de beaux souvenirs ensemble !


🔎 Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ?

Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature 😊


Politique de confidentialité

Les informations que vous fournissez au cours de la procédure de candidature seront utilisées conformément à la politique de confidentialité de Qim info. En soumettant votre candidature, vous reconnaissez et acceptez les conditions énoncées dans cette déclaration de confidentialité.

4133404356,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-reporting-analyst-at-ralph-lauren-4133404356?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=ks3sFezMthbj1pEI005BLQ%3D%3D,Business & Reporting Analyst,Ralph Lauren,"Plan-les-Ouates, Geneva, Switzerland","Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.
Provide cross functional analysis and design powerful visualizations to support our stakeholders in making strategic decisions.
Develop standards and tools to enhance automation of reports and connections to/from them.
Design, Create, Implement, And Maintain Reporting And Tools By
Coordinating with other data analyst/data scientist/IT teams to lead common projects and drive best practice solutions that are aligned company wide
Collecting, monitoring, and analyzing data to identify areas of improvements, risks, and business changes
Maintaining databases and tools, and performing updates as necessary to ensure accuracy
Developing new tools to continuously improve process efficiency and integrate new business requirements
Collecting cross-functional analysis & reporting needs, department tools and opportunities for standardization and automation of processes.
Designing, producing, enhancing reports, dashboards and tools for the Integrated Business Planning function including Inventory Management
Helping to drive critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports
Providing suggestions based on findings that might be utilized to inform business strategies
Providing an on-going presence ‘on the ground’ to help end users leverage the tools and available training
Being the first “line of support” when an issue arises
Education level: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or a related discipline
Strong technical and analytical skills. Aptitude for problem solving and for turning data inputs into relevant information
High degree of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and VBA
Strong SQL and SAP BI skills are highly desirable
Power Query, DataIku, MS Azure, MS Access, Python would be a strong plus
What Is Required For This Position
Efficient time management, priority setting, and capacity to meet deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy, curiosity, and a mindset of continuous learning and improvement
Passionate team player with ability to take ownership and accountability for tasks
Fluent in reading, speaking, and writing in English, with French a strong plus

4129607911,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/international-client-data-analyst-intern-at-cartier-4129607911?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=0BY5mCNph9HcRmIrHGYLjQ%3D%3D,International Client Data Analyst Intern,Cartier,"Meyrin, Geneva, Switzerland","Join the Client Marketing Data Knowledge
This position is embedded within the dynamic Client Marketing team, which is based on four key pillars: Client Relations, Client Services, Client Insights, and Client Marketing Data & Knowledge.

As an International Client Data Analyst Intern, you'll be part of the Client Marketing Data & Knowledge team, reporting to the International Senior Client Data Analyst. This internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the Maison's Client Knowledge strategy.

You'll play a key role in updating and enriching our annual Client Profiling analysis, providing markets with detailed KPIs on their clients' behavior. This analysis is crucial for understanding client preferences, trends, and opportunities for growth.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?
Update and enrich our annual Client Profiling analysis
Elevate Client Knowledge: Be part of the refinement and development of our annual Client Profiling analysis.
Data Visualization Expertise: Master tools like Power BI or Looker to craft insightful dashboards.
QA Tester: Conduct tests to ensure the accuracy, completeness and consistency of Client Profiling data.
Streamline Deployment: Manage project deliveries with meticulous planning, follow-up, and coordination, ensuring smooth execution.
Leverage this Client Profiling analysis and support Client Community
Bridging the Gap: Facilitate the seamless integration of the Client Profiling analysis with our Looker Clients Analytics platform, creating a unified view of client insights.
Answering Business Questions: conduct ad-hoc client studies to address specific business needs and provide actionable insights.
Knowledge Sharing: Train and support users on the reports, empowering them to extract valuable insights and leverage the data effectively.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Academic Background: You are a Master student looking for an end-of-study internship in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering or from a generalist Engineering/Business school with a specialization in data.
Analytical Mindset: You possess a strong analytical mindset, problem-solving skills, and a creative approach to data analysis.
Technical Proficiency: You have proven experience with SQL and ideally some knowledge of a data visualization tool (Tableau, Looker, Power BI are highly valued).
Organizational Skills: You are organized, detail-oriented, and adept at prioritizing tasks effectively.
Communication & Collaboration: You excel at communication, collaboration, and organization, with the ability to interact effectively with diverse teams.
Language Fluency: You are fluent in both French and English, both written and spoken.
Office Suite Proficiency: You are comfortable working with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc.).

4144335711,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-scientist-w-m-d-at-valuequest-gmbh-4144335711?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=sqwTwdnqWSozaxxf3PrB0A%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Scientist (w/m/d),ValueQuest GmbH,Zürich Metropolitan Area,"Du suchst eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit, bei der du etwas bewegen kannst? Dich inspiriert die Vision, eine Welt zu schaffen, in der Feedback positive Veränderungen ermöglicht? Du hast ein gutes Händchen für Daten? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig.
Wir bei ValueQuest sind spezialisiert auf Marktforschung, insbesondere Mitarbeitendenbefragungen, 360-Grad-Feedbacks und Kundenbefragungen.

Zur Erweiterung unseres Teams suchen wir einen engagierten Data Analyst / Data Scientist (w/m/d), der/die mit technischer Expertise und Begeisterung die Analyse von Mitarbeitenden- und Kundenbefragungen sowie die Erstellung aussagekräftiger, visuell ansprechender Berichte vorantreibt.
******** Bewerbungen bis zum 9. März 2025 an bewerbung@valuequest.ch***********
Erstellen und Optimieren aussagekräftiger, visuell ansprechender Berichte sowie Dashboards basierend auf den gewonnenen Insights
Pflege und Weiterentwicklung unserer Analyse- und Reporting-Tools
Entwicklung neuer Tools und moderner Reporting-Ansätze, wie zum Beispiel KI-gestützte Analysen
Beraten und unterstützen unserer Kunden in datenbasierten Fragestellungen
Ausbildung: Abgeschlossenes (Fach-)Hochschulstudium, idealerweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Statistik, Mathematik, Data Science, Sozialwissenschaften oder ähnlichen Bereichen
Technische Expertise: Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel und VBA sowie PowerPoint
column2: Kenntnisse in Python, R oder Power BI sind von Vorteil

column1: Analytische Stärken: Begeisterung für Daten und ein gutes Zahlenverständnis, gepaart mit der Fähigkeit, Ergebnisse klar zu interpretieren
Statistik-Know-how: Fundierte Kenntnisse in empirischer Sozialforschung und Statistik
Visuelle Kompetenz: Ein Gespür für die klare und ansprechende Darstellung von Daten sowie ein Auge für Details.
Sprachen: Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, Französisch von Vorteil
Persönlichkeit: Hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, Teamfähigkeit, eine selbstständige Arbeitsweise und Eigeninitiative
Kommunikation: Starke Fähigkeiten, um komplexe Daten und Erkenntnisse verständlich aufzubereiten.
Ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabenfeld in einem hoch motivierten und wertschätzenden Team
Freiraum für kreative Ideen und Eigenverantwortung in der Arbeit
Attraktive Sozialleistungen und sechs Wochen Ferien
Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine vollständige Bewerbung (Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben und Zeugnisse) bis zum 9. März 2025 an bewerbung@valuequest.ch.
Für Fragen steht Dir Sabrina Karthe (karthe@valuequest.ch) gerne zur Verfügung. Bitte nur Direktbewerbungen.
Mehr Informationen zu ValueQuest findest Du unter: www.valuequest.ch
Bewirb Dich jetzt und werde Teil des ValueQuest-Teams!

Pensum: 80-100%

Arbeitsort: Zürich, Wollishofen


******** Bewerbungen bis zum 9. März 2025 an bewerbung@valuequest.ch***********


Deine Aufgaben

  • Analyse von Mitarbeitenden-, Kundenbefragungen und 360-Grad-Feedbacks
  • Erstellen und Optimieren aussagekräftiger, visuell ansprechender Berichte sowie Dashboards basierend auf den gewonnenen Insights
  • Pflege und Weiterentwicklung unserer Analyse- und Reporting-Tools
  • Entwicklung neuer Tools und moderner Reporting-Ansätze, wie zum Beispiel KI-gestützte Analysen
  • Selbständige Leitung von Marktforschungsprojekten
  • Programmieren und Betreuen von Online-Befragungen
  • Beraten und unterstützen unserer Kunden in datenbasierten Fragestellungen



Das bringst du mit

  • Ausbildung: Abgeschlossenes (Fach-)Hochschulstudium, idealerweise in Wirtschaftsinformatik,
column2:
Statistik, Mathematik, Data Science, Sozialwissenschaften oder ähnlichen Bereichen
  • Technische Expertise: Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Excel und VBA sowie PowerPoint
column3:
Kenntnisse in Python, R oder Power BI sind von Vorteil
  • Analytische Stärken: Begeisterung für Daten und ein gutes Zahlenverständnis, gepaart mit der Fähigkeit, Ergebnisse klar zu interpretieren
  • Statistik-Know-how: Fundierte Kenntnisse in empirischer Sozialforschung und Statistik
  • Visuelle Kompetenz: Ein Gespür für die klare und ansprechende Darstellung von Daten sowie ein Auge für Details.
  • Sprachen: Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, Französisch von Vorteil
  • Persönlichkeit: Hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, Teamfähigkeit, eine selbstständige Arbeitsweise und Eigeninitiative
  • Kommunikation: Starke Fähigkeiten, um komplexe Daten und Erkenntnisse verständlich aufzubereiten.


    • Das bieten wir dir

    • Ein spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabenfeld in einem hoch motivierten und wertschätzenden Team
    • Freiraum für kreative Ideen und Eigenverantwortung in der Arbeit
    • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home-Office-Möglichkeiten
    • Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege
    • Attraktive Sozialleistungen und sechs Wochen Ferien


    Interessiert?

    Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine vollständige Bewerbung (Lebenslauf, Motivationsschreiben und Zeugnisse) bis zum 9. März 2025 an bewerbung@valuequest.ch.

4151457184,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-data-analyst-internship-at-lastminute-com-4151457184?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=wHy1be5XBR%2FSYjlQkTzB3Q%3D%3D,Product Data Analyst (Internship),lastminute.com,"Chiasso, Ticino, Switzerland","At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in data analytics. This is an exciting opportunity to develop analytical skills, work with real-world data, and contribute to improving the traveler’s journey. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and eager to learn how data drives business decisions, keep on reading!

The candidate will have the opportunity to become an integral part of the team, learning how to extract and analyze data to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to support the optimization of post-sales processes and assist in cross domain projects.
Job Title - Product Data Analyst Intern
Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Assist with data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Learn how to communicate and present results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables
- Currently pursuing or recently completed a STEM degree
- Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
- Interest in digital, ecommerce business and travel industry
- Experience in building pipelines and data models
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!

Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



Job Description

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in data analytics. This is an exciting opportunity to develop analytical skills, work with real-world data, and contribute to improving the traveler’s journey. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and eager to learn how data drives business decisions, keep on reading!

The candidate will have the opportunity to become an integral part of the team, learning how to extract and analyze data to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to support the optimization of post-sales processes and assist in cross domain projects.

The job in brief:

Job Title - Product Data Analyst Intern

Working model - Chiasso hybrid

Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Level - Internship

Location - Chiasso

Contract - Internship - full-time (EUR 36 h/week)

Duration: 12 months

Travel time required - No

What your impact will be

  • Assist with data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
  • Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
  • Learn how to communicate and present results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
  • Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
  • Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables

Qualifications

Your expertise:

- Currently pursuing or recently completed a STEM degree

- Knowledge of SQL and Excel.

- Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.

- Proficiency in English.

Desirable:

- Python

- Interest in digital, ecommerce business and travel industry

- Experience in building pipelines and data models



Additional Information

How we work together:

- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)

- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:

- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes

- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues

- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares

- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)

Wish you were here? We do, too!

Selection process steps*:

- HR interview (10-30 minutes)

- Offline Tech test

- 1st interview (Manager): Test review

- 2nd interview (Manager + team member):

- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)

Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

Eligibility criteria:

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

4151457638,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-data-bi-at-mgi-consultants-4151457638?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=U8%2FJS7Hgmrs99F1Ht0ytNg%3D%3D,Business Analyst Data & BI,MGI Consultants,"Geneva, Switzerland","Compétences obligatoires:
• Expérience de 3 ans et plus en tant qu'analyste métier
• Expérience confirmée (3 ans et plus) dans la spécification des exigences métier et systèmes sous forme de cas d'utilisation et d'User stories (spécification fonctionnelle)
• Maitrise des méthodologies d’analyse (UML, BPMN, etc.)
• Connaissance des outils de modélisation (Visio, Enterprise Architect, etc.)
• Compréhension des architectures de portails numériques et des des technologies cloud
• Expérience de 3 ans et plus dans des équipes Agile/Scrum
• Forte compréhension du domaine de la donnée autour des enjeux (cohérence, intégrité, traçabilité, sécurité, etc) et des concepts (socle de données, MDM, virtualisation, ETL, etc)
• Expertise des outils de reporting et de business intelligence (tels que Power BI, QlikSense)
• Connaissance des lois et réglementations suisses relatives aux marchés publics
• Expertise dans la rédaction de support aux utilisateurs (User Guide)
• Expertise dans la rédaction de documents techniques et fonctionnels
• Eliciter les besoins métiers, en extraire les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles
• Rédiger des spécifications fonctionnelles basées sur les cas d'utilisation et sur des modèles d'entité, en couvrant les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles,
• Décrire les fonctionnalités sous forme de User Story et de critères d'acceptance, les prioriser dans un Backlog
• Animer des ateliers avec les différentes parties prenantes
• Accompagner les développements, en apportant du support fonctionnel et métier à une équipe de développement agile
• Définir et superviser les exigences liées à la gouvernance et à la qualité des données.

Compétences obligatoires:

• Expérience de 3 ans et plus en tant qu'analyste métier

• Expérience confirmée (3 ans et plus) dans la spécification des exigences métier et systèmes sous forme de cas d'utilisation et d'User stories (spécification fonctionnelle)

• Maitrise des méthodologies d’analyse (UML, BPMN, etc.)

• Connaissance des outils de modélisation (Visio, Enterprise Architect, etc.)

• Compréhension des architectures de portails numériques et des des technologies cloud

• Expérience de 3 ans et plus dans des équipes Agile/Scrum

• Forte compréhension du domaine de la donnée autour des enjeux (cohérence, intégrité, traçabilité, sécurité, etc) et des concepts (socle de données, MDM, virtualisation, ETL, etc)

• Expertise des outils de reporting et de business intelligence (tels que Power BI, QlikSense)

• Maitrise de l'outil JIRA


Compétences importantes:

• Connaissance des lois et réglementations suisses relatives aux marchés publics

• Expertise dans la rédaction de support aux utilisateurs (User Guide)

• Expertise dans la rédaction de documents techniques et fonctionnels

• Connaissance de la méthode HERMES


Rôle et activités:

• Eliciter les besoins métiers, en extraire les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles

• Rédiger des spécifications fonctionnelles basées sur les cas d'utilisation et sur des modèles d'entité, en couvrant les exigences fonctionnelles et non fonctionnelles,

• Décrire les fonctionnalités sous forme de User Story et de critères d'acceptance, les prioriser dans un Backlog

• Animer des ateliers avec les différentes parties prenantes

• Accompagner les développements, en apportant du support fonctionnel et métier à une équipe de développement agile

• Définir et superviser les exigences liées à la gouvernance et à la qualité des données.

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across five continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

Lonza is a global leader in life sciences with a comprehensive portfolio that supports our customers across the healthcare continuum. In our Licensing Business Unit, we are committed to fostering innovative solutions and delivering exceptional service to our clients worldwide. We are currently looking for a highly motivated Licensing Data Analyst to join our team, based in Basel, Switzerland. This position will support the digitization projects and molecule forecasting of the licensing business unit.
Define data models and strategies to support analytics and reporting requirements.
Analyze commercial and technical data collection and process to enable advanced analytics and business intelligence.
Identify important business metrics and key indicators to support Licensing growth.
Serve as the point of contact for data analytics-related issues and requirements within Licensing BU.
Lead the design and development of data visualization and reporting solutions, providing intuitive and interactive dashboards for end-users.
Minimum three years work experience in analytical role
column2: advanced skills in Microsoft Suite (Excel, PPT, Sharepoint)
column3: additional Experience in SAP or Salesforce.com a plus.

column2: discerns key factors in business models
column3: collaborates effectively with diverse global partners.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

    Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

    People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

    Reference: R65925
