4149903218,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-in-data-analysis-within-process-development-100%25-at-climeworks-4149903218?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=PqitP%2BuF9dofXJiCRT3RBA%3D%3D,Intern in Data Analysis within Process Development (100%),Climeworks,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks removes CO₂ from the air to fight global warming and protect future generations to come. We develop, build and operate direct air capture (DAC) machines which capture CO₂ directly from the air. The captured carbon dioxide is removed from the air by safely storing it underground, permanently. Founded in 2009 by engineers, Christoph Gebald and Jan Wurzbacher, Climeworks was built with a mission to inspire 1 billion people to remove CO₂ from the air, and is now spearheading the DAC industry globally. It has the world’s largest DAC facility and storage installation in operation and a team of over 300 Climeworkers determined to contribute to a net-zero future. A true climate pioneer, Climeworks is featured as a TIME100 Influential Company 2022 and Global Cleantech 100 Company 2022, driving a revolutionary technology engineered to solve the most pressing issue of our time. We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the world’s greatest challenge.
Your mission at Climeworks is to actively support the Process Development team in various tasks related to testing facilities, operational plants and future projects.
You will develop tools and data visualizations to support analysis of the performance of testing facilities and operational plants.
You will participate in field tests at operational plants and develop tools to aggregate the collected data and use it to improve our modelling capabilities.
You will support the definition and documentation of KPIs for testing and operational facilities.
You will contribute to setting up deviation detection and alerting systems for testing facilities and operational plants.
You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or related fields.
You are eager to learn new concepts, skills, and tools that you might need to complete your assignments.
You are reliable, performance-driven, and maintain a structured working style.
You thrive in both fast-paced team environments and when working independently.

column2: German skills would be an advantage.

column1: You have experience with Python and SQL, additional MATLAB skills would be an advantage.
You are available for a full-time 6-month internship, ideally starting in March/April 2025.

What we offer: A horizontal organization, a great team, an improvement-oriented approach, and a scale-up venture with an innovative technology. Sounds like you? We are looking forward meeting you! Apply now by filling in the online application form and uploading your complete dossier to our careers portal: https://www.climeworks.com/careers.
Our promise: At Climeworks, you are accepted for who you are.

As part of our ongoing journey towards creating a diverse and inclusive environment - we encourage everyone to apply! All qualified applicants are considered for positions, so bring along your knowledge, personal experiences, and fresh perspectives, and together we can solve one of humankind’s greatest challenges. We look forward to getting to know you!

Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks removes CO₂ from the air to fight global warming and protect future generations to come. We develop, build and operate direct air capture (DAC) machines which capture CO₂ directly from the air. The captured carbon dioxide is removed from the air by safely storing it underground, permanently. Founded in 2009 by engineers, Christoph Gebald and Jan Wurzbacher, Climeworks was built with a mission to inspire 1 billion people to remove CO₂ from the air, and is now spearheading the DAC industry globally. It has the world’s largest DAC facility and storage installation in operation and a team of over 300 Climeworkers determined to contribute to a net-zero future. A true climate pioneer, Climeworks is featured as a TIME100 Influential Company 2022 and Global Cleantech 100 Company 2022, driving a revolutionary technology engineered to solve the most pressing issue of our time. We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the world’s greatest challenge.

Will you join us?

Your Mission
Job description

  • Your mission at Climeworks is to actively support the Process Development team in various tasks related to testing facilities, operational plants and future projects.
  • You will develop tools and data visualizations to support analysis of the performance of testing facilities and operational plants.
  • You will participate in field tests at operational plants and develop tools to aggregate the collected data and use it to improve our modelling capabilities.
  • You will support the definition and documentation of KPIs for testing and operational facilities.
  • You will contribute to setting up deviation detection and alerting systems for testing facilities and operational plants.

Your Story
Job requirements

  • You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or related fields.
  • You are eager to learn new concepts, skills, and tools that you might need to complete your assignments.
  • You are reliable, performance-driven, and maintain a structured working style.
  • You thrive in both fast-paced team environments and when working independently.
  • You are fluent in English
column2:
German skills would be an advantage.
  • You have experience with Python and SQL, additional MATLAB skills would be an advantage.
  • You are available for a full-time 6-month internship, ideally starting in March/April 2025.

We look forward to getting to know you!

4143621661,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-specialist-at-actalent-4143621661?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=oUgV9%2FngmRt5fwesMUdOdA%3D%3D,Data Specialist,Actalent,"Basel, Switzerland","One of our more innovative clients is searching for a Data Specialist to act as curator for Large Language Models. While having access to state-of-the-art bioinformatics and biostatistics tools, you will gain toxicological insights from experts in the field, working in close collaboration with toxicologists and other scientists.
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and scientific validity of toxicological data captured by large language models (LLMs)

Cross-check data outputs against original sources, evaluate the reliability of AI-derived information, and contribute to the development of high-quality datasets to support drug safety and development efforts
Review toxicological data output generated by LLMs and validate against original resources
Identify and document discrepancies, errors, or ambiguities in AI-derived data
Ensure consistency, completeness, and scientific accuracy of curated toxicological datasets
Apply toxicological knowledge to evaluate data related to preclinical and clinical toxicities, mechanisms of toxicity, safety biomarkers, and risk assessments
Provide feedback to enhance LLM performance based on identified gaps or inaccuracies in the extracted data
Master’s in Biology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Drug Development, Biotechnology
Experience as Toxicological Data Curator with a background in Biology, Toxicology, Drug Development, or Veterinary Medicine
Experience with data curation, annotation, or systematic review methodologies
Understanding of machine learning, LLMs, or natural language processing (NLP) tools
Experienced in synthesizing complex toxicological data and in presenting conclusions
If you want to learn more about this opportunity, please feel free to reach out directly to abeassalazar@actalentservices.com
*Please note that we can only consider EU/Schengen applications, or valid Swiss permit

One of our more innovative clients is searching for a Data Specialist to act as curator for Large Language Models. While having access to state-of-the-art bioinformatics and biostatistics tools, you will gain toxicological insights from experts in the field, working in close collaboration with toxicologists and other scientists.


Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and scientific validity of toxicological data captured by large language models (LLMs)
  • Cross-check data outputs against original sources, evaluate the reliability of AI-derived information, and contribute to the development of high-quality datasets to support drug safety and development efforts
  • Review toxicological data output generated by LLMs and validate against original resources
  • Identify and document discrepancies, errors, or ambiguities in AI-derived data
  • Ensure consistency, completeness, and scientific accuracy of curated toxicological datasets
  • Apply toxicological knowledge to evaluate data related to preclinical and clinical toxicities, mechanisms of toxicity, safety biomarkers, and risk assessments
  • Provide feedback to enhance LLM performance based on identified gaps or inaccuracies in the extracted data



Requirements:

  • Master’s in Biology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Drug Development, Biotechnology
  • Experience as Toxicological Data Curator with a background in Biology, Toxicology, Drug Development, or Veterinary Medicine
  • Experience with data curation, annotation, or systematic review methodologies
  • Understanding of machine learning, LLMs, or natural language processing (NLP) tools
  • Experienced in synthesizing complex toxicological data and in presenting conclusions


If you want to learn more about this opportunity, please feel free to reach out directly to abeassalazar@actalentservices.com


*Please note that we can only consider EU/Schengen applications, or valid Swiss permit

4151461141,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-data-analyst-temporary-contract-at-lastminute-com-4151461141?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=aAMFlUyocr6iiLGhjrOLrQ%3D%3D,Product Data Analyst (Temporary Contract),lastminute.com,"Chiasso, Ticino, Switzerland","At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to optimise post-sales processes and work on cross domain projects (Login,APP, CRM & Marketing, Consents, etc.).
Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Travel time required - A couple of Business Trips per year to meet the team
Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables
- At least 4 years of experience in a similar role
- Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.
- Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
- Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
- Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business
- Previous experience in the travel industry
- Experience in building pipelines and data models
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



Job Description

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to optimise post-sales processes and work on cross domain projects (Login,APP, CRM &
column2:
Marketing, Consents, etc.).

The job in brief:

Job Title - Product Data Analyst

Working model - Chiasso hybrid

Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Level - Professional

Location - Chiasso

Contract - Temporary full-time (EUR 36 h/week)

Travel time required - A couple of Business Trips per year to meet the team

What your impact will be

  • Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
  • Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
  • Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
  • Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
  • Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
  • Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables

Qualifications

Your expertise:

- At least 4 years of experience in a similar role

- Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.

- Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.

- Proficiency in English.

Desirable:

- Python

- Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis

- Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business

- Previous experience in the travel industry

- Experience in building pipelines and data models



Additional Information

Perks of working with us:

How we work together:

- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (you’ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)

- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:

- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as O’reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes

- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues

- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares

- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)

Wish you were here? We do, too!

Selection process steps*:

- HR interview

- Offline Tech test

- 1st interview (Manager): Test review

- 2nd interview (Manager + team member):

- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)

Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

In this role, you’ll develop and implement algorithmic trading strategies while building the infrastructure to support large-scale quantitative research.
Build and maintain data pipelines for processing and executing low-latency trades in spot, futures, and options markets.
Optimize trading strategies with efficient order placement and alpha signals to minimize slippage.
Develop tools for performance analysis and risk management with portfolio and risk teams.
Evaluate strategies through post-trade analysis and recommend improvements.
Test and refine trading engines with internal data to ensure stability.
Support OTC and market-making desks with liquidity assessments.
Conduct code reviews and ensure best practices in development.
Document systems and processes for internal use.
Collaborate with researchers and developers to integrate research into live trading.
PhD in quantitative finance, computer science, mathematics, or related field.
Experience in high-frequency trading and market making is a must.

column2: Rust or C# knowledge.

column1: Strong skills in statistical modelling, derivatives pricing, or volatility analysis.
Exposure to algorithmic trading and options markets is an asset.

On behalf of our client, Swisslinx is seeking a Quantitative Researcher. In this role, you’ll develop and implement algorithmic trading strategies while building the infrastructure to support large-scale quantitative research.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Build and maintain data pipelines for processing and executing low-latency trades in spot, futures, and options markets.
  • Optimize trading strategies with efficient order placement and alpha signals to minimize slippage.
  • Develop tools for performance analysis and risk management with portfolio and risk teams.
  • Evaluate strategies through post-trade analysis and recommend improvements.
  • Test and refine trading engines with internal data to ensure stability.
  • Support OTC and market-making desks with liquidity assessments.
  • Conduct code reviews and ensure best practices in development.
  • Document systems and processes for internal use.
  • Collaborate with researchers and developers to integrate research into live trading.


Job Requirements:


  • PhD in quantitative finance, computer science, mathematics, or related field.
  • Experience in high-frequency trading and market making is a must.
  • Proficient in Python
column2:
Rust or C# knowledge.
  • Strong skills in statistical modelling, derivatives pricing, or volatility analysis.
  • Exposure to algorithmic trading and options markets is an asset.
  • Fluency in English required.

I seek a senior quantitative researcher with experience researching, modelling, developing, and implementing sophisticated alphas, specialising in systematic equities and/or statistical arbitrage. Global search - visa and relocation to Switzerland if not already resident.
Major global hedge fund ($40+bn, 30-year track record, stellar reputation and world-class team and management) - multi-strat platform.

New team and the first hire for a senior Quant Portfolio Manager with 15 years of successful track record managing over $1bn and $100+mn annual PNL record. No infrastructure build-out, pure alpha research and implementation.

We don't care about the number of years of experience. We care about your alpha research process. We care about the successful trading signals you have developed. We care about your knowledge of the inner mechanics of the trading strategies you work on and are live in the market. We care about the Python code that you write and your implementation process. We care about your strategy performance statistics. We care that you have been trained and appropriately mentored at a Tier One hedge fund, prop trading firm, or investment bank.

anything Crypto, short job tenures, new graduates, risk analysts/managers, portfolio managers, data analysts/scientists, machine learning/AI engineers, fundamental strategies, fixed income, fx, commodities, derivatives pricing.

4142362616,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-in-data-engineering-analytics-limited-6-9-months-70-100%25-all-genders-at-swiss-international-air-lines-4142362616?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=5enJpPz6hvkGRLqZfjYUiA%3D%3D,"Internship in Data Engineering & Analytics (limited 6-9 months, 70-100%, all genders)",Swiss International Air Lines,"Kloten, Zurich, Switzerland","Our Data Insights & Analytics Team leads the analytics and digitalization initiatives integral to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will contribute to enhancing analytics processes and data workflows to support aviation risk management, including safety, security, and compliance.

Support risk-related decision-making at SWISS by applying your data engineering and analytics skills. You will enhance analytics pipelines, implement data workflows, and support the development of our cloud-based analytics and process automation infrastructure.
Design and implement data pipelines for preparation, deployment, evaluation, and monitoring using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
Work with diverse data formats, including SQL tables, JSON files, and other noSQL formats.
Apply programming expertise to streamline and automate processes.
Improve and optimize cloud analytics processes.
Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
Programming experience with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, …)
Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g. MS Azure) is an advantage
Strong technical aptitude and enthusiasm for learning new tools and processes.
Very good spoken and written English skills
For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

column2:
Analytics Team leads the analytics and digitalization initiatives integral to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will contribute to enhancing analytics processes and data workflows to support aviation risk management, including safety, security, and compliance.

Starting date: May 01, 2025

Tasks

Support risk-related decision-making at SWISS by applying your data engineering and analytics skills. You will enhance analytics pipelines, implement data workflows, and support the development of our cloud-based analytics and process automation infrastructure.

  • Design and implement data pipelines for preparation, deployment, evaluation, and monitoring using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
  • Work with diverse data formats, including SQL tables, JSON files, and other noSQL formats.
  • Apply programming expertise to streamline and automate processes.
  • Improve and optimize cloud analytics processes.
  • Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.

Benefits

  • Remote working (e.g. from home)
  • Employee and networking events
  • Subsidized parking or public transport
  • Flexible workhours and part-time working models
  • Discounts
  • Diversity programmes
  • Flight benefits
  • Company health management
  • 25 days of annual vacation

Requirements

  • Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
  • Programming experience with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, …)
  • Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g. MS Azure) is an advantage
  • Strong technical aptitude and enthusiasm for learning new tools and processes.
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and adaptable.
  • Very good spoken and written English skills

For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Chrysanthi Tsimitri

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Assicurare che il trattamento dei dati sia conforme agli articoli 5 e 6 della LAIn.
Ricercare nelle banche dati e preparazione di relazioni brevi e richieste di informazioni connesse alla tematica specifica.

Conoscenza attiva di due lingue nazionali e conoscenza passiva di una terza, nonché una buona conoscenza dell'inglese. Nazionalità svizzera e reputazione irreprensibile.

In tale funzione, lei estrae informazioni su una specifica tematica complessa e assicura che i compiti siano definiti all'interno di un gruppo organizzato in modo indipendente. In tal modo contribuisce alla tempestiva individuazione e alla prevenzione delle minacce contro la Svizzera e la sua popolazione.
Une opportunité unique de contribuer à la sécurité de la Suisse
Persone normali che fanno un lavoro straordinario !

Il Servizio delle attività informative della Confederazione SIC individua e combatte il terrorismo, l'estremismo violento, lo spionaggio, la diffusione di armi di distruzione di massa e dei loro vettori, nonché gli attacchi informatici alle infrastrutture critiche. Ricerca e analizza, in Svizzera e all'estero, informazioni essenziali per la sicurezza del nostro Paese. In questo modo, fornisce un contributo decisivo alla valutazione complessiva della situazione da parte delle autorità politiche.
Il SIC lavora principalmente per il Consiglio federale e per i dipartimenti federali. Supporta inoltre i Cantoni nel mantenimento della sicurezza interna e le autorità giudiziarie a livello federale.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Immunai is an engineering-first platform company aiming to improve therapeutic decision-making throughout the drug discovery and development process. We are mapping the immune system at unprecedented scale and granularity and applying machine learning to this massive clinico-immune database, in order to generate novel insights into disease pathology for our partners - pharma companies and research institutes. We provide a comprehensive, end-to-end solution - from data generation and curation to therapeutics development, that continuously supports and validates the capabilities of our platform.
As drug development is becoming increasingly inefficient, our ultimate goal is to help bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible.
Immunai is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

The Metadata Developers Team, part of the Immunai Software group, focuses on advanced tools and solutions to retrieve, store, handle, and analyze complex descriptive biological data, such as laboratory and clinical metadata, with extensive use of domain ontologies. In close collaboration with Immunai’s biocurators and biology experts, we are continuously advancing our technology and data models to improve the consistency and descriptive power of our vast clinical database, as well as the usability and accessibility of data that feed the company’s most advanced algorithms for therapeutic decision-making and discovery.

As Senior Data Engineer at Immunai, you will master metadata-centric software solutions for biological and clinical knowledge by developing a deep understanding of the bio-curation activity and the related data models and processes. You will translate complex operational and data requirements into modular and efficient tools that aim at seamlessly integrating the various phases of curation. You will also be an interface between data producers and consumers to ensure that maximum value can be extracted from our data assets. While being a major code contributor to new and existing tools, you will also act as a guide and mentor to foster innovation and high-quality coding style across the team. Finally, you will be the liaison with other key figures, such as data architect, data steward, and tech leads from complementary domains, in order to ensure alignment on software development standards, data architecture, and data operational processes.
Location: Zürich, Switzerland. This position requires working in a hybrid model from Immunai offices in Zürich.

Guide and collaborate with other Metadata Dev team members in an agile setting to build and maintain new metadata pipelines and applications, or to enhance existing ones, while promoting consistency and harmonization of different components

Interact with biologists, bioinformaticians, and other cross-functional teams to understand and formalize their data needs and tooling requirements, articulate fit-for-purpose solutions that are also innovative and forward-looking

Take responsibility for the quality and integrity of deliverables - you will overlook the coding practices of the team and make sure that they align with the standards set for the whole Software Development group
Participate and contribute in regular meetings to align on technical and operational decisions with your peers from other teams or other stakeholders
Coordinate and contribute to the documentation, training, and user support efforts
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related field

5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track-record in handling complex datasets, mastering elaborated data processes, and translating challenging product requirements into effective software solutions
Excellent programming skills with Python (must have) and preferably with another modern high-level language
Extensive experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred), including query optimization and good general understanding of database architectures
Familiarity with other data storage technologies (e.g. HDFS, NoSQL databases) and data warehousing platforms (ideally, BigQuery)
Knowledge of common data operations and integration concepts (e.g. ETL, ELT), with proven ability to design efficient solutions and implement the best practices
Basic understanding of modern web development technologies and architectures
An analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills and abstraction power
Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Solid understanding of web development and architecture, preferably with front-end coding experience on the JS TypeScript + React framework
Previous experience with major cloud environments is a strong advantage (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
Coding experience in large Java EE projects is a strong advantage
Some experience with orchestration tools is desirable (e.g. Apache Airflow, Dagster)
Knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication protocols (OAuth, JWT), and data privacy standards is a plus
Familiarity with biotech or healthcare data is also an advantage
You want to make an impact on humankind
You enjoy getting things done and striving for excellence
You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
You are candid, authentic, and transparent

*Please note that when you apply for a position at Immunai, your application will be processed via our recruitment platform Comeet. You can read more about how we process personal data here: https://www.immunai.com/privacy-policy/

About Immunai:

Immunai is an engineering-first platform company aiming to improve therapeutic decision-making throughout the drug discovery and development process. We are mapping the immune system at unprecedented scale and granularity and applying machine learning to this massive clinico-immune database, in order to generate novel insights into disease pathology for our partners - pharma companies and research institutes. We provide a comprehensive, end-to-end solution - from data generation and curation to therapeutics development, that continuously supports and validates the capabilities of our platform.

As drug development is becoming increasingly inefficient, our ultimate goal is to help bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible.

Immunai is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


About the role:

The Metadata Developers Team, part of the Immunai Software group, focuses on advanced tools and solutions to retrieve, store, handle, and analyze complex descriptive biological data, such as laboratory and clinical metadata, with extensive use of domain ontologies. In close collaboration with Immunai’s biocurators and biology experts, we are continuously advancing our technology and data models to improve the consistency and descriptive power of our vast clinical database, as well as the usability and accessibility of data that feed the company’s most advanced algorithms for therapeutic decision-making and discovery.

As Senior Data Engineer at Immunai, you will master metadata-centric software solutions for biological and clinical knowledge by developing a deep understanding of the bio-curation activity and the related data models and processes. You will translate complex operational and data requirements into modular and efficient tools that aim at seamlessly integrating the various phases of curation. You will also be an interface between data producers and consumers to ensure that maximum value can be extracted from our data assets. While being a major code contributor to new and existing tools, you will also act as a guide and mentor to foster innovation and high-quality coding style across the team. Finally, you will be the liaison with other key figures, such as data architect, data steward, and tech leads from complementary domains, in order to ensure alignment on software development standards, data architecture, and data operational processes.

Location: Zürich, Switzerland. This position requires working in a hybrid model from Immunai offices in Zürich.


What will you do?

  • Guide and collaborate with other Metadata Dev team members in an agile setting to build and maintain new metadata pipelines and applications, or to enhance existing ones, while promoting consistency and harmonization of different components
  • Interact with biologists, bioinformaticians, and other cross-functional teams to understand and formalize their data needs and tooling requirements, articulate fit-for-purpose solutions that are also innovative and forward-looking
  • Take responsibility for the quality and integrity of deliverables - you will overlook the coding practices of the team and make sure that they align with the standards set for the whole Software Development group
  • Participate and contribute in regular meetings to align on technical and operational decisions with your peers from other teams or other stakeholders
  • Coordinate and contribute to the documentation, training, and user support efforts


Required qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related field
  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track-record in handling complex datasets, mastering elaborated data processes, and translating challenging product requirements into effective software solutions
  • Excellent programming skills with Python (must have) and preferably with another modern high-level language
  • Extensive experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred), including query optimization and good general understanding of database architectures
  • Familiarity with other data storage technologies (e.g. HDFS, NoSQL databases) and data warehousing platforms (ideally, BigQuery)
  • Knowledge of common data operations and integration concepts (e.g. ETL, ELT), with proven ability to design efficient solutions and implement the best practices
  • Basic understanding of modern web development technologies and architectures
  • An analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills and abstraction power
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken

Preferred qualifications:

  • Solid understanding of web development and architecture, preferably with front-end coding experience on the JS TypeScript + React framework
  • Previous experience with major cloud environments is a strong advantage (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
  • Coding experience in large Java EE projects is a strong advantage
  • Some experience with orchestration tools is desirable (e.g. Apache Airflow, Dagster)
  • Knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication protocols (OAuth, JWT), and data privacy standards is a plus
  • Familiarity with biotech or healthcare data is also an advantage

Desired personal traits:

  • You want to make an impact on humankind
  • You prioritize “We” over “I”
  • You enjoy getting things done and striving for excellence
  • You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
  • You have a growth mindset
  • You are candid, authentic, and transparent


*Please note that when you apply for a position at Immunai, your application will be processed via our recruitment platform Comeet. You can read more about how we process personal data here: https://www.immunai.com/privacy-policy/

In this internship, you will play a key role in developing and improving data analytics products that are vital to managing aviation risks, including safety, security, and compliance.
You may apply in English or German

Support risk-related decision-making across all operational domains of SWISS by leveraging your data visualization and communication skills. You will transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights and help manage our data analytics product portfolio.
Develop and enhance dashboards in Tableau and Power BI, creating intuitive and insightful visualizations.
Modify and maintain data pipelines on platforms like Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
Translate business requirements into scalable data science and automation solutions.
Present data products and findings effectively to non-technical audiences.
Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
Experience in programming with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python …)
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau or PowerBI)
Strong interest in data communication and storytelling
Self-motivated, reliable, and eager to learn
Excellent spoken and written English skills
For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

column2:
Analytics Team drives the analytics and digitalization processes that are essential to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will play a key role in developing and improving data analytics products that are vital to managing aviation risks, including safety, security, and compliance.

Starting date: May 01, 2025

You may apply in English or German

Tasks

Support risk-related decision-making across all operational domains of SWISS by leveraging your data visualization and communication skills. You will transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights and help manage our data analytics product portfolio.

  • Develop and enhance dashboards in Tableau and Power BI, creating intuitive and insightful visualizations.
  • Modify and maintain data pipelines on platforms like Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
  • Translate business requirements into scalable data science and automation solutions.
  • Present data products and findings effectively to non-technical audiences.
  • Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.

Benefits

  • Discounts
  • 25 days of annual vacation
  • Company health management
  • Subsidized parking or public transport
  • Diversity programmes
  • Remote working (e.g. from home)
  • Flight benefits
  • Employee and networking events
  • Flexible workhours and part-time working models

Requirements

  • Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
  • Experience in programming with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python …)
  • Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau or PowerBI)
  • Strong interest in data communication and storytelling
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and eager to learn
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills

For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Chrysanthi Tsimitri

recruiting.services@swiss.com

4135210755,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-sql-developer-at-nicoll-curtin-4135210755?position=31&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=ta3lTpX%2BznbbNl0mLdePpg%3D%3D,Junior SQL Developer,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","We are in search of a Junior SQL Developer to join our client in Zurich.

In this role, you'll be handle client issues, analyze the SQL database to identify problems, write scripts to fix minor issues, and escalate complex problems to the development team. Over time, you will work more independently.
Fluency in German at a C1 or C2 is essential for this position.
This opportunity is perfect for you if you have 1-2 years of experience in SQL and scripting, ideally in Python, and possess familiarity with PostgreSQL and Linux.
If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

We are in search of a Junior SQL Developer to join our client in Zurich.


In this role, you'll be handle client issues, analyze the SQL database to identify problems, write scripts to fix minor issues, and escalate complex problems to the development team. Over time, you will work more independently.


Fluency in German at a C1 or C2 is essential for this position.


This opportunity is perfect for you if you have 1-2 years of experience in SQL and scripting, ideally in Python, and possess familiarity with PostgreSQL and Linux.


If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

4102338385,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-100%25-at-bank-cic-switzerland-4102338385?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=xoirxMokgx3%2FhFxgK4lC0w%3D%3D,Data Analyst (100%),Bank CIC |Switzerland|,"Basel, Switzerland","Sie werden Mitglied eines dynamischen Teams in der Finanz-Abteilung. Kurze und einfache Kommunikationswege, dank Nähe des Haupt-Auftraggebers, erleichtern unser Alltag. Unser kleines Team ist bestrebt, hochwertige Informationen und Wissen aus dem breiten Datenuniversum der Bank zu erzeugen. Wir erledigen alle Schritte von der Datenbeschaffung bis zur Auswertung. Innovation und Einsatz von moderne Technologien liegt uns am Herzen und KI ist der nächste Schritt.
Sie erfassen und dokumentieren die Aufträge und erstellen die technischen Anforderungen, zusammen mit dem Auftraggeber
Sie importieren Daten aus den Quellsysteme und führen Datenanalysen durch
Sie entwickeln Prozeduren im Data Warehouse für die Berechnung von KPI und liefern Berichten
Sie entwickeln Dashboard und dokumentieren Ihre Entwicklungen
Sie automatisieren wiederkehren Aufgaben, Reports oder Prozeduren
Sie prüfen die Datenqualität und Datenintegrität über alle Produkten
Sie arbeiten an Konzepte für neue Produkte und entwickeln KI-Modelle oder setzen KI Werkzeuge ein

Sie verfügen über einen Berufs- oder Studienabschluss in Informatik/Wirtschaftsinformatik und können bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Warehouse/BI eines Finanzdienstleisters vorweisen. Im Umgang mit Excel und mit relationale Datenbanken wie MS SQL Server (oder Oracle) sind Sie bestens vertraut und darüber hinaus verfügen Sie ebenso über gute Programmierkenntnisse (T-SQL). Sie haben bestenfalls Kenntnisse von QlikSense (oder PowerBI). Erfahrungen mit Jedox sowie mit der Bankenplattform Avaloq sind von Vorteil. Ebenfalls sind Erfahrungen mit Python und Data Science Aufgaben vom Vorteil für kommende Projekte. Sie zeichnen sich vor allem durch Ihr analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen aus und erledigen Ihre Arbeit mit viel Eigeninitiative, selbständig sowie lösungsorientiert. Ein hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein, grosse Lernbereitschaft sowie ein hohes Mass an Verantwortungsbewusstsein setzen wir in dieser Funktion absolut voraus. Fliessendes Deutsch und gute Französisch Kenntnisse (oder umgekehrt) runden Ihr Profil ab.

Die Möglichkeit, an innovativen Projekten mitzuwirken und Ihre Ideen einzubringen sowie ein unterstützendes und motiviertes Team, das gemeinsam grosse Ziele erreichen möchte, erwartet Sie. Bei uns wird viel Wert auf die Übernahme von Verantwortung gelegt, hierzu bieten wir viel Spielraum. Eingebettet in den Finanzkonzern der Gruppe Crédit Mutuel bieten wir Ihnen nebst attraktiven Konditionen auch Sicherheit und Kontinuität. Eine sehr gute Vorsorge und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sind weitere Pluspunkte.
Stellenantritt per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung.

4136200105,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bess-performance-analyst-at-coopers-group-ag-4136200105?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=wF7yWNYpjxfKxNa1911h1A%3D%3D,BESS Performance Analyst,Coopers Group AG,"Solothurn, Switzerland","As a BESS Performance Analyst, you will develop the concept, thrive the implementation and later own the operative performance monitoring framework.
Based on market research and industry-best practice, you will propose and drive the rollout and implementation of the framework.
You will identify and analyze key metrics and provide insights that maximize the efficiency, performance and reliability of the future BESS asset portfolio.
This “first of its kind” role offers a unique opportunity to thrive, shape and create real impact in a dynamic environment - first BESS project will go life already by Q3/2025!
Develop an overarching and scalable performance monitoring concept for BESS
Identify and prioritize the critical performance indicators (KPI)s and relevant stakeholders
Lead project specific implementation and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
Conduct market-research on tools and industry best practice, thrive implementation of performance monitoring systems and relevant stakeholder reporting
Design early warning systems to detect and address potential performance issues
Ensure warranty compliance by monitoring system operations.
Work closely with technical and legal teams, project and asset management
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Renewable Energy, or a related field
Proven track record in energy systems performance analysis (5+ years), ideally in the field of utility scale BESS
Strong skills in data analysis (Python, SQL, Excel) and SCADA systems
In-depth understanding of BESS technology, including lithium-ion batteries, power electronics, and thermal management
Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a detail-oriented approach

column2: additional languages (German/French) are a plus

column1: Here’s what you can look forward to: You’ll be joining a modern, future-focused company that not only drives innovative projects but also places great importance on the well-being of its employees. You can expect numerous attractive benefits, including flexible working hours, opportunities for professional development, a supportive team, modern workspaces, and comprehensive health and leisure programs. This is your chance to advance your career in an inspiring environment while contributing to a sustainable vision for the future.

As a BESS Performance Analyst, you will develop the concept, thrive the implementation and later own the operative performance monitoring framework.

Based on market research and industry-best practice, you will propose and drive the rollout and implementation of the framework.

You will identify and analyze key metrics and provide insights that maximize the efficiency, performance and reliability of the future BESS asset portfolio.

This “first of its kind” role offers a unique opportunity to thrive, shape and create real impact in a dynamic environment - first BESS project will go life already by Q3/2025!


Your main responsibilities:

  • Develop an overarching and scalable performance monitoring concept for BESS
  • Identify and prioritize the critical performance indicators (KPI)s and relevant stakeholders
  • Lead project specific implementation and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Conduct market-research on tools and industry best practice, thrive implementation of performance monitoring systems and relevant stakeholder reporting
  • Design early warning systems to detect and address potential performance issues
  • Ensure warranty compliance by monitoring system operations.
  • Work closely with technical and legal teams, project and asset management


Your profile:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Renewable Energy, or a related field
  • Proven track record in energy systems performance analysis (5+ years), ideally in the field of utility scale BESS
  • Strong skills in data analysis (Python, SQL, Excel) and SCADA systems
  • In-depth understanding of BESS technology, including lithium-ion batteries, power electronics, and thermal management
  • Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a detail-oriented approach
  • Fluency in English
column2:
additional languages (German/French) are a plus


Here’s what you can look forward to: You’ll be joining a modern, future-focused company that not only drives innovative projects but also places great importance on the well-being of its employees. You can expect numerous attractive benefits, including flexible working hours, opportunities for professional development, a supportive team, modern workspaces, and comprehensive health and leisure programs. This is your chance to advance your career in an inspiring environment while contributing to a sustainable vision for the future.

4051710462,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-energy-data-portfolio-analyst-at-totalenergies-4051710462?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=H1LJSHNGs2jewd1CKa9j%2BQ%3D%3D,Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst,TotalEnergies,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.
In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.
The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.
Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.

At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.
TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &

    • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
    • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


    At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

    Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

    Informations supplémentaires

    TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

4149696549,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/quantitative-research-analyst-at-calibrium-4149696549?position=35&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=JRFUWQfKCp2c5tCVMULwEQ%3D%3D,Quantitative Research Analyst,Calibrium,"Zurich, Switzerland","Calibrium AG is a private Investment Office that invests in a broad range of asset classes globally. We are fundamental long-term investors looking for a highly motivated and analytically minded professional to join our team as a Quantitative Research Analyst (100%). The ideal candidate possesses a practical mindset, excels at applying their skills to real-world challenges, and is adept at developing effective solutions.

You are intensely curious, have a passion for solving complex problems presented by financial markets and a strong willingness to learn and self-educate about new investment opportunities/strategies. You work diligently and have a hands-on approach. You will be reporting to the co-head of the Liquid Investment Division.
Oversee the codebase, providing quality control, troubleshooting, and support
Execute ad-hoc projects that require both coding expertise and advanced quantitative skills
Support the team’s trade execution activities
Enhance existing asset allocation and portfolio construction models across both liquid and illiquid asset classes
Improve and develop the current return and risk forecasting models and optimize systematic investment strategies
Develop tactical asset allocation models informed by market and macroeconomic signals
Keep abreast of industry and academic research to identify and incorporate relevant innovations
University degree in mathematics, statistics, econometrics, quantitative finance, computer science or physics
column2: CFA is a plus

column1: Strong programming skills in Python with the ability to write clear code

Exceptional analytical skills with 3+ years of experience in financial data analysis, alpha research, portfolio construction, back-testing, simulation and building quantitative non-latency sensitive trading strategies
Ability to present complex ideas in an intuitive and easy to follow manner and work in an international team
Demonstrable passion for investing and markets
Excellent command of written and spoken English
column2: German is a plus

column1: Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate
An environment uniquely dedicated to investing
A culture of open discussion, intellectual honesty and constructive dissent
A platform on which to improve and grow your already significant talents
Calibrium provides a challenging and fair work environment in an international team.
We only consider applications which include a motivational letter and CV (no more than 2 pages). Please send your complete application documents to: hr@clbrm.com.

Calibrium AG is a private Investment Office that invests in a broad range of asset classes globally. We are fundamental long-term investors looking for a highly motivated and analytically minded professional to join our team as a Quantitative Research Analyst (100%). The ideal candidate possesses a practical mindset, excels at applying their skills to real-world challenges, and is adept at developing effective solutions.


You are intensely curious, have a passion for solving complex problems presented by financial markets and a strong willingness to learn and self-educate about new investment opportunities/strategies. You work diligently and have a hands-on approach. You will be reporting to the co-head of the Liquid Investment Division.



Responsibilities

  • Oversee the codebase, providing quality control, troubleshooting, and support
  • Execute ad-hoc projects that require both coding expertise and advanced quantitative skills
  • Support the team’s trade execution activities
  • Enhance existing asset allocation and portfolio construction models across both liquid and illiquid asset classes
  • Improve and develop the current return and risk forecasting models and optimize systematic investment strategies
  • Develop tactical asset allocation models informed by market and macroeconomic signals
  • Keep abreast of industry and academic research to identify and incorporate relevant innovations



Requirements

  • University degree in mathematics, statistics, econometrics, quantitative finance, computer science or physics
column2:
CFA is a plus
  • Strong programming skills in Python with the ability to write clear code
  • Exceptional analytical skills with 3+ years of experience in financial data analysis, alpha research, portfolio construction, back-testing, simulation and building quantitative non-latency sensitive trading strategies
  • Ability to present complex ideas in an intuitive and easy to follow manner and work in an international team
  • Demonstrable passion for investing and markets
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English
column3:
German is a plus
  • Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate



    • We offer

    • An environment uniquely dedicated to investing
    • A culture of open discussion, intellectual honesty and constructive dissent
    • A platform on which to improve and grow your already significant talents
    • Responsibility given early
    • Compensation commensurate with performance



    Calibrium provides a challenging and fair work environment in an international team.


    We only consider applications which include a motivational letter and CV (no more than 2 pages). Please send your complete application documents to: hr@clbrm.com.

We are a dynamic, growing consulting firm in Lugano, focused on delivering high‐impact data solutions. Unlike large consultancies, we give you the freedom to lead, innovate, and see direct results from your work. You’ll play a pivotal role in shaping data strategy for our clients while enjoying a flexible and supportive environment.
Dive into 25+ years of historical data, identifying trends, gaps, and improvement areas.
Assess data structures and document findings clearly for stakeholders.
Consolidate information from legacy systems (e.g., Microsoft Access).
Collaborate on setting business rules for data retention and clarity.
Eliminate redundant, corrupted, or outdated records.
Ensure compliance with Swiss data regulations (e.g., FADP) and high‐qualitystandards.
Manage ETL processes using SQL and scripting languages (Python or R).
Leverage BI tools (Tableau, Power BI) for data visualization and presentations.
Communicate progress, solutions, and key insights to both technical and non‐technical teams.
Work closely with clients and internal leadership to understand evolving data needs.
5–8 years of hands‐on experience in data analysis, data engineering, or similar roles.
Fluency (C1) in Italian and English to liaise with local and international stakeholders.
Solid Experience with Microsoft Access, legacy database systems, SQL, and data cleaning best practices.
Familiarity with ETL frameworks, scripting (Python, R), and BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Strong Communication & Documentation Skills – comfortable presenting complex data insights in plain language.
Self‐Motivated & Flexible – able to handle multiple priorities in a small consulting environment.
High Impact: Your work directly shapes client outcomes—you’ll see the tangible results of your efforts.
Professional Growth: From shaping data pipelines to leading entire projects, you’ll have plenty of ownership and learning opportunities.
Visibility & Recognition: Collaborate closely with leadership and clients
column2: your contributions won’t get lost in a large corporate hierarchy.

Christian Matzinger, Leiter Kompetenzzentrum Data Analytics, +41 81 288 65 66

Dass du mit uns etwas bewegen willst, ist für uns die grösste Motivation. Darum verzichten wir bei dieser Stelle auf ein Motivationsschreiben. Falls du uns deine Motivation dennoch mitteilen möchtest, hast du in unserem Bewerbungstool nach wie vor die Möglichkeit dazu.
Deshalb bist du die richtige Person
Deshalb bist du die richtige Person

Möchtest du etwas bewegen und täglich am Puls des öffentlichen Verkehrs tätig sein? Wenn ja, dann bist du bei uns in Chur richtig als

Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst 50-100% (m/w/d)

Eintritt erfolgt nach Vereinbarung.

Das kannst du bewirken

  • Anbindung, Aufbereitung und Analyse von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen zur Gewinnung wertvoller Einblicke und Identifikation von Trends
  • Erstellung, Pflege und Weiterentwicklung interaktiver, aussagekräftiger Berichte und Dashboards in Microsoft Power BI sowie Sicherstellung der Datenqualität und -konsistenz
  • Analyse von Geschäftsanforderungen in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen sowie Beratung hinsichtlich Auswertungsmöglichkeiten und Interpretation von Kennzahlen
  • Mitverantwortung für den Betrieb und die Verwaltung des Power BI Service einschliesslich Benutzerverwaltung, Arbeitsbereiche und Bereitstellung von Inhalten
  • Durchführung von Anwenderschulungen sowie Unterstützung der Endbenutzer bei Fragen und Problemen im Zusammenhang mit Power BI

Deshalb bist du die richtige Person

  • Abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Masterstudium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Data Science oder einem verwandten Bereich
  • Begeisterung für die Aufbereitung und Analyse grosser Datenmengen
  • Erfahrung im Aufbau und der Pflege von Datenmodellen sowie tiefes Verständnis für Kennzahlen und Reporting-Anforderungen
  • Umfassende Kenntnisse in Microsoft Power BI (Desktop und Service), dem Aufbau von Semantikmodellen und der Definition von Measures mit DAX
  • Engagierte, selbständige Persönlichkeit mit ausgeprägten analytischen Fähigkeiten

Das bieten wir dir

  • 2. Klasse Generalabonnement
  • Freifahrscheine und Vergünstigungen auf Bahnfahrten im Ausland
  • Bezahltes Mobiltelefon und -Abo zur geschäftlichen und privaten Nutzung
  • Flexible Teilzeitmodelle
  • Attraktive Sozialnebenleistungen und gesunde Pensionskasse
  • Zusätzlicher Kauf von Ferien
  • Möglichkeit zur internen und externen Weiterbildung mit finanzieller Unterstützung durch die RhB

Auskünfte

Weitere Auskünfte erteilen dir gerne

Christian Matzinger, Leiter Kompetenzzentrum Data Analytics, +41 81 288 65 66

Sabrina Marchetti, HR Beraterin, +41 81 288 62 16

4151284761,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-qualient-technology-solutions-uk-limited-4151284761?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=v48P5QMeCpV8R8%2BTmOgfBQ%3D%3D,Data Engineer,Qualient Technology Solutions UK Limited,"Geneva, Switzerland","Job Description:-
Understanding and supporting our existing data pipelines, as well as developing new ones.
Contributing to the modernization of our data platform.
Onboarding a variety of internal and external data sources.
Ensuring data quality through validation and verification processes.
Provisioning data infrastructure for data ingestion, storage, and processing.
Managing the releases of new features while guaranteeing the production stability.
Automating, orchestrating, monitoring data pipelines, and reacting to alerts.
Preparing models to distribute data to stakeholders.
A university degree in Computer Science, or a related field, or a qualification deemed equivalent.
Past experience with Informatica PowerCenter for maintaining on-premises data pipelines.
Good experience with cloud services, particularly AWS, and familiarity with Terraform.
Experience in Python development, specifically with libraries for data handling such as Pandas and dbt.
Experience with cloud data warehouses and/or data virtualization would be highly advantageous.
Experience with Microsoft Fabric and Power BI would be highly advantageous.
Familiarity with modern software development processes, including Jira, Git, and CI/CD tools.
A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong knowledge of data modelling for analytics (star schema) as well as functional modeling for distributing data through REST API.
Fluency in both spoken and written French (good to have) and English.
Must be a resident of Switzerland.

Job Description:-

  • Understanding and supporting our existing data pipelines, as well as developing new ones.
  • Contributing to the modernization of our data platform.
  • Onboarding a variety of internal and external data sources.
  • Ensuring data quality through validation and verification processes.
  • Provisioning data infrastructure for data ingestion, storage, and processing.
  • Managing the releases of new features while guaranteeing the production stability.
  • Automating, orchestrating, monitoring data pipelines, and reacting to alerts.
  • Preparing models to distribute data to stakeholders.

Experience required

  • A university degree in Computer Science, or a related field, or a qualification deemed equivalent.
  • Proven experience in data engineering.
  • Excellent knowledge of SQL.
  • Past experience with Informatica PowerCenter for maintaining on-premises data pipelines.
  • Good experience with cloud services, particularly AWS, and familiarity with Terraform.
  • Experience in Python development, specifically with libraries for data handling such as Pandas and dbt.
  • Experience with cloud data warehouses and/or data virtualization would be highly advantageous.
  • Experience with Microsoft Fabric and Power BI would be highly advantageous.
  • Familiarity with modern software development processes, including Jira, Git, and CI/CD tools.
  • A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Strong knowledge of data modelling for analytics (star schema) as well as functional modeling for distributing data through REST API.
  • Basic understanding of financial products.
  • Fluency in both spoken and written French (good to have) and English.
  • Must be a resident of Switzerland.

4142125246,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/career-starter-data-science-m-w-d-at-sbb-cff-ffs-4142125246?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=0oi3%2F3PVcVnQy923hJrxeg%3D%3D,Career Starter Data Science (m/w/d),SBB CFF FFS,"Bern, Berne, Switzerland","Beweg mit uns die Schweiz als

In verschiedenen Förderstellen entlang eines Kernbereichs kannst du dein Wissen und deine Erfahrungen rund um das Thema Data Science sammeln und dieses direkt anwenden. Zusätzlich durchläufst du unser Einführungsprogramm und hast die Möglichkeit, dein Fachwissen in spezifischen Kursen zu vertiefen. Mehr zu unseren Career Starter Programmen findest du hier.
Du erarbeitest dir während 18 Monaten in 3 verschiedenen Förderstellen, Kursen und Workshops ein solides Wissen, um ein:e Spezialist:in im Umgang mit Daten zu werden.

In den Bereichen Personenverkehr, Infrastruktur und/oder IT entwickelst du ein Verständnis für unterschiedliche Sichtweisen von Business und Analytics. Durch deine empfängergerechte Kommunikation und die Anwendung von verschiedenen Visualisierungsmethoden gelingt es dir, deine Erkenntnisse verständlich für verschiedene Stakeholder zu präsentieren.
In Projekten entwickelst und implementierst du Analysemodelle und Algorithmen und unterstützt somit Fachexpert:innen aus verschiedenen Abteilungen bei der Umsetzung von anspruchsvollen Vorhaben.
Du entwickelst deine Kompetenzen in Bereichen wie Programmierung (Python/R), Versionierung, Machine Learning, Data Engineering, APIs, Self-Service BI, Data-/ML-Ops etc.

Die Anwendung der Statistik und mathematischer Modelle gehört zu deinem Daily Business: Du sammelst, selektierst und analysierst quantitativ grosse Datenmengen und bereitest diese in wertschöpfender Weise auf.
Du zeichnest dich durch eine hohe Eigeninitiative und Leistungsbereitschaft aus. Deine analytischen Fähigkeiten sowie deine Visualisierungsfähigkeit ergänzen dein Profil.

Als Teamplayer:in mit ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und deiner Faszination für die Mobilität freust du dich, immer wieder neue Herausforderungen anzunehmen und dich in verschiedene Teams einzuarbeiten.
Du verfügst über einen Hochschulabschluss (Uni, FH, Bachelor/Master) in einem MINT Bereich (Mathematik, Informatik, Naturwissenschaft oder Technik) oder in Volkswirtschaft oder Wirtschaftsinformatik.
Du konntest dir bereits erste Kenntnisse in Statistik, im Umgang mit den neusten Methodiken und in der Programmiersprache Python oder R aneignen.
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B2) und gute Englischkenntnisse (B1) setzen wir für diese Funktion voraus.

Dass du mit uns die Schweiz bewegen willst, ist für uns die grösste Motivation. Darum verzichten wir bei dieser Stelle auf ein Motivationsschreiben. Falls du uns deine Motivation dennoch mitteilen möchtest, hast du in unserem Bewerbungstool nach wie vor die Möglichkeit dazu. Grosses machen ist einfacher per du. Das beginnt bereits bei deiner Bewerbung.
Für diese Stelle nehmen wir keine Dossiers von Personalvermittlern entgegen.
Matthias Minder matthias.minder@sbb.ch Emanuel Zwyssig emanuel.zwyssig@sbb.ch
