Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?
Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig!

Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.
Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad-hoc-Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten
Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit erfolgreicher Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.

160 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.
Unser Slogan lautet PUSHING THE LIMITS!
Bist du bereit, mit uns einen neuen Weg zu gehen? Dann verliere keine Zeit und bewirb dich jetzt.
Unsere HR Generalistin, Pia-Maria Burkhardt, freut sich auf deine ausführliche Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) per E-Mail: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

4143378917,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/toxicological-data-specialist-data-curator-80-100%25-6355-%E2%80%93-kfr-at-ctc-resourcing-solutions-ag-4143378917?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=wW5%2FxvstDd6XoKRTBjHDRw%3D%3D,Toxicological Data specialist / Data curator (80-100%) (6355 – KFR),CTC Resourcing Solutions AG,"Basel, Switzerland","The Life Science Career Network

CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.

Our client is a pioneer in Drug Discovery and Development and one of the frontrunners in Personalised Healthcare. As the world`s largest R&D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they work in a vast number of drug discovery & therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.
We are currently looking for a Toxicological Data Curator for a 6-month contract (with possibility for extension) based in Basel, Switzerland.

As a team member in the Prediction Modelling (PM) Chapter of Pharmaceutical Science, you will work in close collaboration with toxicologists as well as other scientists in pRED, having access to state-of-the-art bioinformatics and biostatistics tools and methods and gaining toxicological insights from experts in the field.

Large Language Models (LLMs) have evolved beyond simple text completion tools into sophisticated systems capable of data extraction, summarization, enrichment, and knowledge capture. These advancements enable the retrieval of information previously locked within documents, reports, presentations, and meeting records, making it possible to repurpose this data and reverse translate knowledge from the past to inform future insights.

The position in question focuses on transforming historical toxicology documents into structured, high-quality datasets through AI-powered extraction while supporting the application of LLMs for toxicological data understanding and enrichment from historical documents. The extracted data will be used to enhance existing data repositories and serve as a foundation for creating new ones tailored to the specific needs of toxicologists.

While LLMs hold immense potential, they are also prone to generating inaccurate or fabricated information, commonly referred to as ""hallucinations."" To address this, rigorous data curation is essential. Curating and validating subsets of the extracted data will not only improve the quality and reliability of the outputs but also contribute to refining and enhancing the performance of the models themselves.

We are looking for a highly skilled and detail-oriented Toxicological Data Curator with a background in biology or toxicology or drug development or veterinary medicine etc . In this role, you will ensure the accuracy, consistency, and scientific validity of toxicological data captured by large language models (LLMs). You will cross-check data outputs against original sources, evaluate the reliability of AI-derived information, and contribute to the development of high-quality datasets to support drug safety and development efforts.
Review toxicological data output generated by LLMs and validate it against original resources (e.g., research articles, regulatory documents, toxicology databases).
Identify and document discrepancies, errors, or ambiguities in AI-derived data.
Build up pipeline/dataset (choose one if needed) for toxicological evaluation tasks
Ensure consistency, completeness, and scientific accuracy of curated toxicological datasets.
Adhere to established quality control protocols and contribute to improving workflows as needed.
Apply toxicological knowledge to evaluate data related to preclinical and clinical toxicities, mechanisms of toxicity, safety biomarkers, and risk assessments.
Assess relevance and applicability of curated data to specific drug development scenarios.
Work closely with computational toxicologists, data scientists, and cross-functional teams to align on curation standards and requirements.
Provide feedback to enhance LLM performance based on identified gaps or inaccuracies in the extracted data.
Maintain detailed records of validation processes and outcomes.
Prepare periodic reports summarizing curation progress, data quality metrics, and key findings.
Relevant working/residency permit or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required
Preferred Master’s in Biology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Drug Development, Biotechnology or a related field
Experience with data curation, annotation, or systematic review methodologies is a plus
Basic understanding of machine learning, LLMs, or natural language processing (NLP) tools is desirable but not required.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills, particularly in evaluating scientific information
Ability to synthesize complex toxicological data and present clear, actionable conclusions
Effective written and verbal communication skills for reporting and collaboration

The Life Science Career Network


CTC are specialised industry experts who can help companies source the best talent and provide reliable HR and consulting services, support varied candidates in finding promising career opportunities and offer the latest in skill development training programmes.


Toxicological Data specialist / Data curator


Our client is a pioneer in Drug Discovery and Development and one of the frontrunners in Personalised Healthcare. As the world`s largest R&
column2: D spender in the pharmaceutical and diagnostics domain, they work in a vast number of drug discovery &amp
column3:
therapeutic areas and are highly recognized internationally.


We are currently looking for a Toxicological Data Curator for a 6-month contract (with possibility for extension) based in Basel, Switzerland.

Home Office: 49%, On-site: 51%


Background:

As a team member in the Prediction Modelling (PM) Chapter of Pharmaceutical Science, you will work in close collaboration with toxicologists as well as other scientists in pRED, having access to state-of-the-art bioinformatics and biostatistics tools and methods and gaining toxicological insights from experts in the field.


Large Language Models (LLMs) have evolved beyond simple text completion tools into sophisticated systems capable of data extraction, summarization, enrichment, and knowledge capture. These advancements enable the retrieval of information previously locked within documents, reports, presentations, and meeting records, making it possible to repurpose this data and reverse translate knowledge from the past to inform future insights.


The position in question focuses on transforming historical toxicology documents into structured, high-quality datasets through AI-powered extraction while supporting the application of LLMs for toxicological data understanding and enrichment from historical documents. The extracted data will be used to enhance existing data repositories and serve as a foundation for creating new ones tailored to the specific needs of toxicologists.


While LLMs hold immense potential, they are also prone to generating inaccurate or fabricated information, commonly referred to as ""hallucinations."" To address this, rigorous data curation is essential. Curating and validating subsets of the extracted data will not only improve the quality and reliability of the outputs but also contribute to refining and enhancing the performance of the models themselves.


We are looking for a highly skilled and detail-oriented Toxicological Data Curator with a background in biology or toxicology or drug development or veterinary medicine etc . In this role, you will ensure the accuracy, consistency, and scientific validity of toxicological data captured by large language models (LLMs). You will cross-check data outputs against original sources, evaluate the reliability of AI-derived information, and contribute to the development of high-quality datasets to support drug safety and development efforts.


Main Responsibilities:

Data Validation:

  • Review toxicological data output generated by LLMs and validate it against original resources (e.g., research articles, regulatory documents, toxicology databases).
  • Identify and document discrepancies, errors, or ambiguities in AI-derived data.
  • Build up pipeline/dataset (choose one if needed) for toxicological evaluation tasks

Quality Assurance:

  • Ensure consistency, completeness, and scientific accuracy of curated toxicological datasets.
  • Adhere to established quality control protocols and contribute to improving workflows as needed.

Toxicology Expertise:

  • Apply toxicological knowledge to evaluate data related to preclinical and clinical toxicities, mechanisms of toxicity, safety biomarkers, and risk assessments.
  • Assess relevance and applicability of curated data to specific drug development scenarios.

Collaboration:

  • Work closely with computational toxicologists, data scientists, and cross-functional teams to align on curation standards and requirements.
  • Provide feedback to enhance LLM performance based on identified gaps or inaccuracies in the extracted data.

Documentation and Reporting:

  • Maintain detailed records of validation processes and outcomes.
  • Prepare periodic reports summarizing curation progress, data quality metrics, and key findings.


Qualifications and Experience:

  • Relevant working/residency permit or Swiss/EU-Citizenship required
  • Preferred Master’s in Biology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Drug Development, Biotechnology or a related field
  • Experience with data curation, annotation, or systematic review methodologies is a plus
  • Basic understanding of machine learning, LLMs, or natural language processing (NLP) tools is desirable but not required.
  • English fluent (min. C1 Level)
  • Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy
  • Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills, particularly in evaluating scientific information
  • Ability to synthesize complex toxicological data and present clear, actionable conclusions
  • Effective written and verbal communication skills for reporting and collaboration

4125913467,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/d%C3%A9veloppeur-data-intelligence-junior-at-qim-info-4125913467?position=47&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=TcOkdNbQNO9IgHmGa8Ol6A%3D%3D,Développeur Data Intelligence Junior,Qim info,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004, Qim info est implantée en Suisse 🇨🇭 (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich & Bâle) et en France 🇫🇷 (Annecy, Lyon & Paris). Appartenant au groupe MoOngy, l’entreprise bénéficie aussi d’un réseau de développement international 🌐.

3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études & Développement 💻, Fonctionnel 🔧, Infrastructures & Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).
Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟
Nous recrutons actuellement un(e) Développeur(euse) Data Intelligence pour accompagner les équipes de notre client grand compte.

Conception, développement, test et déploiement des applications décisionnelles (DI) du domaine concerné, incluant les environnements analytiques, les tableaux de bord, les rapports opérationnels et les interfaces de données.
Gestion des petites demandes d'évolution des applications décisionnelles du domaine.
Prise en charge et résolution des incidents liés aux applications décisionnelles du domaine.
Bonnes connaissances des concepts de Business Intelligence.
Bonne maitrise du langage SQL et du SGBD Oracle.
2 ans d'expérience sur un poste similaire.
Premier contact : Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est à votre écoute pour comprendre votre parcours et vos attentes 🎧.
Entretien technique : Échangez avec un de nos collaborateurs pour parler technique 🛠️.
Entretien avec un Business Manager : Découvrez les missions et projets en détail 🎯.
Expertise reconnue : Activité dans une dizaine de secteurs et une connaissance des métiers de l’IT 🌐.
Suivi RH & managérial de qualité : Accompagnement dans votre montée en compétences et vos missions au quotidien 🌟.
Culture d’entreprise : Partagez plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim tech talks, soirées annuelles et trimestrielles, Afterwork Qim... de nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année 🎉.
Satisfaction des consultants : Chez Qim info, on est bien et ce sont nos consultants qui le disent mieux que nous sur Glassdoor (note de 4,1/5) 🌟.
Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature !
Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004, Qim info est implantée en Suisse 🇨🇭 (Genève, Lausanne, Zurich &
column2: Bâle) et en France 🇫🇷 (Annecy, Lyon &amp
column3:
Paris). Appartenant au groupe MoOngy, l’entreprise bénéficie aussi d’un réseau de développement international 🌐.


3e entreprise informatique de Suisse romande (ICT Journal), Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un système d’information sur différents métiers (Études &
column5:
Réseaux 🌐, Data 📊, DevOps 🚀...) et différents secteurs d’activités (Banque 🏦, Finance 💰, Assurance 📜, Luxe ✨, Retail 🛍️, Aéronautique ✈️...).


Avec plus de 650 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents ! 🌟


En quelques mots 🎯

Nous recrutons actuellement un(e) Développeur(euse) Data Intelligence pour accompagner les équipes de notre client grand compte.


Responsabilités principales :

  • Conception, développement, test et déploiement des applications décisionnelles (DI) du domaine concerné, incluant les environnements analytiques, les tableaux de bord, les rapports opérationnels et les interfaces de données.
  • Gestion des petites demandes d'évolution des applications décisionnelles du domaine.
  • Prise en charge et résolution des incidents liés aux applications décisionnelles du domaine.


Profil recherché :

  • Bonnes connaissances des concepts de Business Intelligence.
  • Bonne maitrise du langage SQL et du SGBD Oracle.
  • Résidence Suisse.
  • 2 ans d'expérience sur un poste similaire.


Conditions du poste :

  • Lieu : Lausanne


Les étapes pour nous rencontrer :

  1. Premier contact : Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est à votre écoute pour comprendre votre parcours et vos attentes 🎧.
  2. Entretien technique : Échangez avec un de nos collaborateurs pour parler technique 🛠️.
  3. Entretien avec un Business Manager : Découvrez les missions et projets en détail 🎯.


Pourquoi choisir Qim info ?

  • Expertise reconnue : Activité dans une dizaine de secteurs et une connaissance des métiers de l’IT 🌐.
  • Suivi RH &
column6:
managérial de qualité : Accompagnement dans votre montée en compétences et vos missions au quotidien 🌟.
  • Culture d’entreprise : Partagez plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim tech talks, soirées annuelles et trimestrielles, Afterwork Qim... de nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année 🎉.
  • Satisfaction des consultants : Chez Qim info, on est bien et ce sont nos consultants qui le disent mieux que nous sur Glassdoor (note de 4,1/5) 🌟.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Joining Mirabaud, means entering an entrepreneurial and innovative environment. With the 7th generation of the Mirabaud family working within the bank, the culture is that of a family business. With over 750 employees based in 10 countries worldwide, Mirabaud offers opportunities to develop one’s career across an international network of 16 offices.

Mirabaud is proud to announce the launching of the largest project since its foundation in 1819, pushing ahead its highly regarded entrepreneurial and passionate team to the next level of client servicing thanks to the adoption of enhanced digital front and back-office capabilities. To support this ambitious digital transformation and migration to the cloud, our Data Hub, Reporting & MIS team is looking to add:
A Day In Your Future Job
Work with IT Application owners and Business Analysts to capture and define data Hub requirements
Actively participates with our Data Architect in the functional and technical target solution
Participate in the construction and evolution of our Data Hub (pySpark, Azure Synapse)
Participate in providing or extracting data from the Data Hub for various consumers (Client and Regulatory Reporting, etc.)
Respect the instructions and standards in place, design, perform and execute unit tests
Organize and deliver trainings to the Application support team members
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Data Engineer
Degree in computer engineering or related field
Very good knowledge of pySpark, Microsoft Azure Cloud and Synapse
Knowledge of Wealth Management sector, an asset
Knowledge of PureView and PowerApps, an asset
Fluent in French and good command of English
Creative, problem solver and team player with great adaptability skills
Direct impact on the business, no matter your position or seniority
Work in an environment that encourages autonomy and entrepreneurship
Flexible working arrangements to help you achieve a better work-life balance
Variety of cultural and sporting activities during your free time
Various employee benefits & family friendly benefits.

4139635801,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/online-data-analyst-at-telus-digital-4139635801?position=51&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=lOL3AqQZgg86Fk0qxNq7mQ%3D%3D,Online Data Analyst,TELUS Digital,"Lucerne, Switzerland","Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.
A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:
In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.
Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.

No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreemen

4149906987,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/stagiaire-epfl-intelligence-artificielle-%E2%80%93-analyste-de-donn%C3%A9es-appliqu%C3%A9es-ia-et-gestion-intelligente-du-froid-at-digitel-sa-le-froid-ma%C3%AEtris%C3%A9-4149906987?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=cD2fJzY6PNU5UdHGK7mWUQ%3D%3D,Stagiaire EPFL intelligence artificielle – Analyste de données appliquées - IA et gestion intelligente du froid,Digitel SA | Le froid maîtrisé,"Cugy (Vaud), Vaud, Switzerland","Entreprise familiale, Digitel SA (www.digitel.swiss) fournit depuis plus de 35 ans des solutions de régulation dans le domaine de la réfrigération. Nos automates de régulation et notre logiciel de supervision gèrent et surveillent plus d’un millier d’installations frigorifiques de clients actifs principalement dans la grande distribution alimentaire et dans l’industrie, en Suisse et en Europe.

Notre nouvel outil d’analyse énergétique « Amicool », qui exploite le traitement et l’analyse des données par un algorithme d’intelligence artificielle, est en train de révolutionner le monde du froid pour les supermarchés en promettant des économies d’énergie grâce à des diagnostics automatisés plus rapides et plus précis.
Afin de renforcer notre équipe Amicool, nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) stagiaire EPFL engagé(e) sur notre site de Cugy (VD) :
Stagiaire EPFL intelligence artificielle – Analyste de données appliquées - IA et gestion intelligente du froid (6 mois)
Vous êtes curieux, autonome, et vous avez une appétence pour les projets innovants ?

Nous vous offrons un travail varié et passionnant, ainsi qu’une opportunité de créer un réel impact sur un produit innovant et ultramoderne, à la croisée de sujets porteurs comme l’intelligence artificielle et la durabilité. Nous sommes une petite équipe - bienveillante et passionnée - prête à vous accompagner dans votre montée en compétences.

En tant que stagiaire analyste de données appliquées, vous serez au cœur de l’optimisation de solutions IA appliquées à la gestion du froid. Vous interviendrez sur plusieurs aspects du projet, de l'analyse des données à la mise en œuvre de modèles prédictifs et d'optimisation en temps réel.
Vous serez amené à collaborer avec le reste de l’équipe sur l’une ou l’autre des activités suivantes :
Collecte, traitement et nettoyage des données issues des systèmes de gestion du froid.
Développement et entraînement de modèles de machine learning pour prédire et optimiser la consommation d'énergie.
Mise en place d'algorithmes de gestion intelligente du froid dans des environnements réels.
Analyse des performances des modèles et proposition de pistes d’amélioration.
Collaboration avec les équipes techniques pour intégrer les solutions IA dans les systèmes existants.
Rédaction de rapports techniques et présentation des résultats obtenus.
Cette offre de stage s'adresse à un(e) étudiant(e) EPFL à la recherche d'un stage de fin d'étude.
Des connaissances solides en IA, machine learning et analyse de données
Une familiarité avec les arbres de décision et l'utilisation de métriques adaptées.
Une bonne maîtrise des langages de programmation Python
Une expérience avec les outils de traitement et de gestion de données (SQL, bases de données NoSQL) serait un plus.
Une maîtrise des protocoles de communication MQTT pour la gestion de messages en temps réel entre appareils connectés.
Des compétences en gestion de bases de données relationnelles (MariaDB, MySQL, etc.).
Des compétences en optimisation et en gestion de l’énergie sont un atout.
Une expérience ou une familiarité avec l’environnement Amazon AWS est un atout.
Un excellent esprit d’analyse, un sens de l'initiative et une capacité à travailler en équipe.
La maîtrise du français est requise.
Vous voulez en savoir plus? Nous répondons volontiers à vos questions au 021 731 07 60. Votre dossier de candidature complet peut nous être envoyé à l’adresse : jobs@digitel.swiss
Lieu de travail: 1053 Cugy (VD) Type de contrat :
Stage Masters concernés : - Science et ingénierie computationnelles - Informatique - Système de communication - Science des données ou tout autre profil se retrouvant dans le descriptif.
Date de début : Dès février 2025 et jusqu’en septembre

Entreprise familiale, Digitel SA (www.digitel.swiss) fournit depuis plus de 35 ans des solutions de régulation dans le domaine de la réfrigération. Nos automates de régulation et notre logiciel de supervision gèrent et surveillent plus d’un millier d’installations frigorifiques de clients actifs principalement dans la grande distribution alimentaire et dans l’industrie, en Suisse et en Europe.


Notre nouvel outil d’analyse énergétique « Amicool », qui exploite le traitement et l’analyse des données par un algorithme d’intelligence artificielle, est en train de révolutionner le monde du froid pour les supermarchés en promettant des économies d’énergie grâce à des diagnostics automatisés plus rapides et plus précis.


Afin de renforcer notre équipe Amicool, nous sommes à la recherche d'un(e) stagiaire EPFL engagé(e) sur notre site de Cugy (VD) :


Stagiaire EPFL intelligence artificielle – Analyste de données appliquées - IA et gestion intelligente du froid (6 mois)


Vous êtes curieux, autonome, et vous avez une appétence pour les projets innovants ?

Nous vous offrons un travail varié et passionnant, ainsi qu’une opportunité de créer un réel impact sur un produit innovant et ultramoderne, à la croisée de sujets porteurs comme l’intelligence artificielle et la durabilité. Nous sommes une petite équipe - bienveillante et passionnée - prête à vous accompagner dans votre montée en compétences.


Mission

En tant que stagiaire analyste de données appliquées, vous serez au cœur de l’optimisation de solutions IA appliquées à la gestion du froid. Vous interviendrez sur plusieurs aspects du projet, de l'analyse des données à la mise en œuvre de modèles prédictifs et d'optimisation en temps réel.

Vous serez amené à collaborer avec le reste de l’équipe sur l’une ou l’autre des activités suivantes :

  • Collecte, traitement et nettoyage des données issues des systèmes de gestion du froid.
  • Développement et entraînement de modèles de machine learning pour prédire et optimiser la consommation d'énergie.
  • Mise en place d'algorithmes de gestion intelligente du froid dans des environnements réels.
  • Analyse des performances des modèles et proposition de pistes d’amélioration.
  • Collaboration avec les équipes techniques pour intégrer les solutions IA dans les systèmes existants.
  • Rédaction de rapports techniques et présentation des résultats obtenus.


Profil recherché

Cette offre de stage s'adresse à un(e) étudiant(e) EPFL à la recherche d'un stage de fin d'étude.


Nous recherchons un(e) candidat(e) ayant :

  • Des connaissances solides en IA, machine learning et analyse de données
  • Une familiarité avec les arbres de décision et l'utilisation de métriques adaptées.
  • Une bonne maîtrise des langages de programmation Python
  • Une expérience avec les outils de traitement et de gestion de données (SQL, bases de données NoSQL) serait un plus.
  • Une maîtrise des protocoles de communication MQTT pour la gestion de messages en temps réel entre appareils connectés.
  • Des compétences en gestion de bases de données relationnelles (MariaDB, MySQL, etc.).
  • Des compétences en optimisation et en gestion de l’énergie sont un atout.
  • Une expérience ou une familiarité avec l’environnement Amazon AWS est un atout.
  • Un excellent esprit d’analyse, un sens de l'initiative et une capacité à travailler en équipe.
  • La maîtrise du français est requise.


Vous voulez en savoir plus? Nous répondons volontiers à vos questions au 021 731 07 60. Votre dossier de candidature complet peut nous être envoyé à l’adresse : jobs@digitel.swiss


Lieu de travail: 1053 Cugy (VD) Type de contrat :

Stage Masters concernés : - Science et ingénierie computationnelles - Informatique - Système de communication - Science des données ou tout autre profil se retrouvant dans le descriptif.


  • Date de début : Dès février 2025 et jusqu’en septembre
  • Durée du stage: jusqu'à 6 mois

4142362616,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-in-data-engineering-analytics-limited-6-9-months-70-100%25-all-genders-at-swiss-international-air-lines-4142362616?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=6fD%2FWEHuVzJ30Nb34eYv9g%3D%3D,"Internship in Data Engineering & Analytics (limited 6-9 months, 70-100%, all genders)",Swiss International Air Lines,"Kloten, Zurich, Switzerland","Our Data Insights & Analytics Team leads the analytics and digitalization initiatives integral to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will contribute to enhancing analytics processes and data workflows to support aviation risk management, including safety, security, and compliance.

Support risk-related decision-making at SWISS by applying your data engineering and analytics skills. You will enhance analytics pipelines, implement data workflows, and support the development of our cloud-based analytics and process automation infrastructure.
Design and implement data pipelines for preparation, deployment, evaluation, and monitoring using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
Work with diverse data formats, including SQL tables, JSON files, and other noSQL formats.
Apply programming expertise to streamline and automate processes.
Improve and optimize cloud analytics processes.
Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
Programming experience with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, …)
Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g. MS Azure) is an advantage
Strong technical aptitude and enthusiasm for learning new tools and processes.
Very good spoken and written English skills
For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

column2:
Analytics Team leads the analytics and digitalization initiatives integral to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will contribute to enhancing analytics processes and data workflows to support aviation risk management, including safety, security, and compliance.

Starting date: May 01, 2025

Tasks

Support risk-related decision-making at SWISS by applying your data engineering and analytics skills. You will enhance analytics pipelines, implement data workflows, and support the development of our cloud-based analytics and process automation infrastructure.

  • Design and implement data pipelines for preparation, deployment, evaluation, and monitoring using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
  • Work with diverse data formats, including SQL tables, JSON files, and other noSQL formats.
  • Apply programming expertise to streamline and automate processes.
  • Improve and optimize cloud analytics processes.
  • Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.

Benefits

  • Remote working (e.g. from home)
  • Employee and networking events
  • Subsidized parking or public transport
  • Flexible workhours and part-time working models
  • Discounts
  • Diversity programmes
  • Flight benefits
  • Company health management
  • 25 days of annual vacation

Requirements

  • Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
  • Programming experience with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python, R, …)
  • Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g. MS Azure) is an advantage
  • Strong technical aptitude and enthusiasm for learning new tools and processes.
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and adaptable.
  • Very good spoken and written English skills

For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Chrysanthi Tsimitri

recruiting.services@swiss.com

4147795580,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intelligence-specialist-in-materia-di-terrorismo-e-di-estremismo-violento-analista-di-dati-e-triage-at-general-secretariat-gs-ddps-4147795580?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=K3d3PFboElbUN3xayPWArw%3D%3D,Intelligence Specialist in materia di Terrorismo e di estremismo violento (analista di dati e triage).,General Secretariat GS-DDPS,"Bern, Berne, Switzerland","Servizio delle attività informative della Confederazione SIC, 80-100%, Berna
Registrare in modo strutturato e pertinente le informazioni nei sistemi informativi del SIC.
Assicurare che il trattamento dei dati sia conforme agli articoli 5 e 6 della LAIn.
Ricercare nelle banche dati e preparazione di relazioni brevi e richieste di informazioni connesse alla tematica specifica.
Analizzare i dati delle relazioni e dei documenti assegnati.
Formazione di base commerciale o una formazione equivalente. Esperienza nella gestione dei dati.
Perspicacia e capacità di trattare con perseveranza problemi complessi. Buone competenze redazionali.
Ampia conoscenza delle questioni di sicurezza nazionale e internazionale.
Un alto livello di competenza sociale e di capacità di lavoro in squadra.
Conoscenza attiva di due lingue nazionali e conoscenza passiva di una terza, nonché una buona conoscenza dell'inglese. Nazionalità svizzera e reputazione irreprensibile.

In tale funzione, lei estrae informazioni su una specifica tematica complessa e assicura che i compiti siano definiti all'interno di un gruppo organizzato in modo indipendente. In tal modo contribuisce alla tempestiva individuazione e alla prevenzione delle minacce contro la Svizzera e la sua popolazione.
Une opportunité unique de contribuer à la sécurité de la Suisse
Persone normali che fanno un lavoro straordinario !

Il Servizio delle attività informative della Confederazione SIC individua e combatte il terrorismo, l'estremismo violento, lo spionaggio, la diffusione di armi di distruzione di massa e dei loro vettori, nonché gli attacchi informatici alle infrastrutture critiche. Ricerca e analizza, in Svizzera e all'estero, informazioni essenziali per la sicurezza del nostro Paese. In questo modo, fornisce un contributo decisivo alla valutazione complessiva della situazione da parte delle autorità politiche.
Il SIC lavora principalmente per il Consiglio federale e per i dipartimenti federali. Supporta inoltre i Cantoni nel mantenimento della sicurezza interna e le autorità giudiziarie a livello federale.
Lavorare per la SvizzeraCi adoperiamo per il modello di successo svizzero e lavoriamo per il benessere della popolazione.
Vivere la diversitàLa concretizzazione delle pari opportunità ci consente di esprimere al meglio le nostre competenze e di contemplare punti di vista differenti.
In forma sul posto di lavoroForniamo supporto e consulenza alle nostre collaboratrici e ai nostri collaboratori sulla tematica della salute fisica e mentale.
Per ulteriori informazioni si prega di contattare via e-mail jobs@ndb.admin.ch
Per motivi di sicurezza, la preghiamo di trasmetterci il suo dossier di candidatura in formato cartaceo.
Si Prega Di Inviare La Propria Candidatura (lettera Di Motivazione, CV, Carta D'identità/passaporto, Copie Dei Certificati Di Lavoro, Copie Dei Diplomi) Al Seguente Indirizzo
Dipartimento federale della difesa, della protezione della popolazione e dello sport DDPS
Possibilità di lavoro decentralizzato al di fuori di Berna in parte o a determinate condizioni.
La candidatura è trattata con discrezione in vista di un'assunzione presso il SIC.
Le offerte provenienti da uffici di collocamento del personale non saranno prese in considerazione.

Servizio delle attività informative della Confederazione SIC, 80-100%, Berna

Il contributo che può dare

  • Registrare in modo strutturato e pertinente le informazioni nei sistemi informativi del SIC.
  • Assicurare che il trattamento dei dati sia conforme agli articoli 5 e 6 della LAIn.
  • Ricercare nelle banche dati e preparazione di relazioni brevi e richieste di informazioni connesse alla tematica specifica.
  • Analizzare i dati delle relazioni e dei documenti assegnati.

Che cosa La contraddistingue

  • Formazione di base commerciale o una formazione equivalente. Esperienza nella gestione dei dati.
  • Perspicacia e capacità di trattare con perseveranza problemi complessi. Buone competenze redazionali.
  • Ampia conoscenza delle questioni di sicurezza nazionale e internazionale.
  • Un alto livello di competenza sociale e di capacità di lavoro in squadra.
  • Conoscenza attiva di due lingue nazionali e conoscenza passiva di una terza, nonché una buona conoscenza dell'inglese. Nazionalità svizzera e reputazione irreprensibile.

In questo modo, fornisce un contributo decisivo alla valutazione complessiva della situazione da parte delle autorità politiche.

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Immunai is an engineering-first platform company aiming to improve therapeutic decision-making throughout the drug discovery and development process. We are mapping the immune system at unprecedented scale and granularity and applying machine learning to this massive clinico-immune database, in order to generate novel insights into disease pathology for our partners - pharma companies and research institutes. We provide a comprehensive, end-to-end solution - from data generation and curation to therapeutics development, that continuously supports and validates the capabilities of our platform.
As drug development is becoming increasingly inefficient, our ultimate goal is to help bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible.
Immunai is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

The Metadata Developers Team, part of the Immunai Software group, focuses on advanced tools and solutions to retrieve, store, handle, and analyze complex descriptive biological data, such as laboratory and clinical metadata, with extensive use of domain ontologies. In close collaboration with Immunai’s biocurators and biology experts, we are continuously advancing our technology and data models to improve the consistency and descriptive power of our vast clinical database, as well as the usability and accessibility of data that feed the company’s most advanced algorithms for therapeutic decision-making and discovery.

As Senior Data Engineer at Immunai, you will master metadata-centric software solutions for biological and clinical knowledge by developing a deep understanding of the bio-curation activity and the related data models and processes. You will translate complex operational and data requirements into modular and efficient tools that aim at seamlessly integrating the various phases of curation. You will also be an interface between data producers and consumers to ensure that maximum value can be extracted from our data assets. While being a major code contributor to new and existing tools, you will also act as a guide and mentor to foster innovation and high-quality coding style across the team. Finally, you will be the liaison with other key figures, such as data architect, data steward, and tech leads from complementary domains, in order to ensure alignment on software development standards, data architecture, and data operational processes.
Location: Zürich, Switzerland. This position requires working in a hybrid model from Immunai offices in Zürich.

Guide and collaborate with other Metadata Dev team members in an agile setting to build and maintain new metadata pipelines and applications, or to enhance existing ones, while promoting consistency and harmonization of different components

Interact with biologists, bioinformaticians, and other cross-functional teams to understand and formalize their data needs and tooling requirements, articulate fit-for-purpose solutions that are also innovative and forward-looking

Take responsibility for the quality and integrity of deliverables - you will overlook the coding practices of the team and make sure that they align with the standards set for the whole Software Development group
Participate and contribute in regular meetings to align on technical and operational decisions with your peers from other teams or other stakeholders
Coordinate and contribute to the documentation, training, and user support efforts
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related field

5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track-record in handling complex datasets, mastering elaborated data processes, and translating challenging product requirements into effective software solutions
Excellent programming skills with Python (must have) and preferably with another modern high-level language
Extensive experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred), including query optimization and good general understanding of database architectures
Familiarity with other data storage technologies (e.g. HDFS, NoSQL databases) and data warehousing platforms (ideally, BigQuery)
Knowledge of common data operations and integration concepts (e.g. ETL, ELT), with proven ability to design efficient solutions and implement the best practices
Basic understanding of modern web development technologies and architectures
An analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills and abstraction power
Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Solid understanding of web development and architecture, preferably with front-end coding experience on the JS TypeScript + React framework
Previous experience with major cloud environments is a strong advantage (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
Coding experience in large Java EE projects is a strong advantage
Some experience with orchestration tools is desirable (e.g. Apache Airflow, Dagster)
Knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication protocols (OAuth, JWT), and data privacy standards is a plus
Familiarity with biotech or healthcare data is also an advantage
You want to make an impact on humankind
You enjoy getting things done and striving for excellence
You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
You are candid, authentic, and transparent

*Please note that when you apply for a position at Immunai, your application will be processed via our recruitment platform Comeet. You can read more about how we process personal data here: https://www.immunai.com/privacy-policy/

About Immunai:

Immunai is an engineering-first platform company aiming to improve therapeutic decision-making throughout the drug discovery and development process. We are mapping the immune system at unprecedented scale and granularity and applying machine learning to this massive clinico-immune database, in order to generate novel insights into disease pathology for our partners - pharma companies and research institutes. We provide a comprehensive, end-to-end solution - from data generation and curation to therapeutics development, that continuously supports and validates the capabilities of our platform.

As drug development is becoming increasingly inefficient, our ultimate goal is to help bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible.

Immunai is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


About the role:

The Metadata Developers Team, part of the Immunai Software group, focuses on advanced tools and solutions to retrieve, store, handle, and analyze complex descriptive biological data, such as laboratory and clinical metadata, with extensive use of domain ontologies. In close collaboration with Immunai’s biocurators and biology experts, we are continuously advancing our technology and data models to improve the consistency and descriptive power of our vast clinical database, as well as the usability and accessibility of data that feed the company’s most advanced algorithms for therapeutic decision-making and discovery.

As Senior Data Engineer at Immunai, you will master metadata-centric software solutions for biological and clinical knowledge by developing a deep understanding of the bio-curation activity and the related data models and processes. You will translate complex operational and data requirements into modular and efficient tools that aim at seamlessly integrating the various phases of curation. You will also be an interface between data producers and consumers to ensure that maximum value can be extracted from our data assets. While being a major code contributor to new and existing tools, you will also act as a guide and mentor to foster innovation and high-quality coding style across the team. Finally, you will be the liaison with other key figures, such as data architect, data steward, and tech leads from complementary domains, in order to ensure alignment on software development standards, data architecture, and data operational processes.

Location: Zürich, Switzerland. This position requires working in a hybrid model from Immunai offices in Zürich.


What will you do?

  • Guide and collaborate with other Metadata Dev team members in an agile setting to build and maintain new metadata pipelines and applications, or to enhance existing ones, while promoting consistency and harmonization of different components
  • Interact with biologists, bioinformaticians, and other cross-functional teams to understand and formalize their data needs and tooling requirements, articulate fit-for-purpose solutions that are also innovative and forward-looking
  • Take responsibility for the quality and integrity of deliverables - you will overlook the coding practices of the team and make sure that they align with the standards set for the whole Software Development group
  • Participate and contribute in regular meetings to align on technical and operational decisions with your peers from other teams or other stakeholders
  • Coordinate and contribute to the documentation, training, and user support efforts


Required qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related field
  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track-record in handling complex datasets, mastering elaborated data processes, and translating challenging product requirements into effective software solutions
  • Excellent programming skills with Python (must have) and preferably with another modern high-level language
  • Extensive experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred), including query optimization and good general understanding of database architectures
  • Familiarity with other data storage technologies (e.g. HDFS, NoSQL databases) and data warehousing platforms (ideally, BigQuery)
  • Knowledge of common data operations and integration concepts (e.g. ETL, ELT), with proven ability to design efficient solutions and implement the best practices
  • Basic understanding of modern web development technologies and architectures
  • An analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills and abstraction power
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken

Preferred qualifications:

  • Solid understanding of web development and architecture, preferably with front-end coding experience on the JS TypeScript + React framework
  • Previous experience with major cloud environments is a strong advantage (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
  • Coding experience in large Java EE projects is a strong advantage
  • Some experience with orchestration tools is desirable (e.g. Apache Airflow, Dagster)
  • Knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication protocols (OAuth, JWT), and data privacy standards is a plus
  • Familiarity with biotech or healthcare data is also an advantage

Desired personal traits:

  • You want to make an impact on humankind
  • You prioritize “We” over “I”
  • You enjoy getting things done and striving for excellence
  • You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
  • You have a growth mindset
  • You are candid, authentic, and transparent


*Please note that when you apply for a position at Immunai, your application will be processed via our recruitment platform Comeet. You can read more about how we process personal data here: https://www.immunai.com/privacy-policy/

4142309376,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-in-data-analytics-visualization-limited-6-9-months-70-100%25-all-genders-at-swiss-international-air-lines-4142309376?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=WE7mc66SjbArrakdjFzX%2Fg%3D%3D,"Internship in Data Analytics & Visualization (limited 6-9 months, 70-100%, all genders)",Swiss International Air Lines,"Kloten, Zurich, Switzerland","Our Data Insights & Analytics Team drives the analytics and digitalization processes that are essential to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will play a key role in developing and improving data analytics products that are vital to managing aviation risks, including safety, security, and compliance.
You may apply in English or German

Support risk-related decision-making across all operational domains of SWISS by leveraging your data visualization and communication skills. You will transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights and help manage our data analytics product portfolio.
Develop and enhance dashboards in Tableau and Power BI, creating intuitive and insightful visualizations.
Modify and maintain data pipelines on platforms like Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
Translate business requirements into scalable data science and automation solutions.
Present data products and findings effectively to non-technical audiences.
Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
Experience in programming with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python …)
Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau or PowerBI)
Strong interest in data communication and storytelling
Self-motivated, reliable, and eager to learn
Excellent spoken and written English skills
For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

column2:
Analytics Team drives the analytics and digitalization processes that are essential to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will play a key role in developing and improving data analytics products that are vital to managing aviation risks, including safety, security, and compliance.

Starting date: May 01, 2025

You may apply in English or German

Tasks

Support risk-related decision-making across all operational domains of SWISS by leveraging your data visualization and communication skills. You will transform complex datasets into clear, actionable insights and help manage our data analytics product portfolio.

  • Develop and enhance dashboards in Tableau and Power BI, creating intuitive and insightful visualizations.
  • Modify and maintain data pipelines on platforms like Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
  • Translate business requirements into scalable data science and automation solutions.
  • Present data products and findings effectively to non-technical audiences.
  • Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.

Benefits

  • Discounts
  • 25 days of annual vacation
  • Company health management
  • Subsidized parking or public transport
  • Diversity programmes
  • Remote working (e.g. from home)
  • Flight benefits
  • Employee and networking events
  • Flexible workhours and part-time working models

Requirements

  • Master’s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etc…)
  • Experience in programming with proficiency in at least one language (e.g. SQL, Python …)
  • Hands-on experience with data visualization tools (preferably Tableau or PowerBI)
  • Strong interest in data communication and storytelling
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and eager to learn
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills

For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Chrysanthi Tsimitri

recruiting.services@swiss.com

4147671057,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-data-analyst-m-f-d-at-merck-healthcare-4147671057?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=wXtJ8DTz%2BgVjEouvfjbuRA%3D%3D,Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d),Merck Healthcare,"Aubonne, Vaud, Switzerland","Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.
Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.
Currently pursuing a master’s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous

What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!
Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

Start date: April 2025

Duration: 6 months

Location: Aubonne, Switzerland

Your Role

  • Collect and analyze data for various products or services offered by the company.
  • Contribute to creating performance reports and dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or AERA
  • Support the business to creating dashboard that allow the identification of trends, patterns, or anomalies that might indicate issues or opportunities for improvement.
  • Resolve technical and functional issues on existing dashboards.
  • Interact cross-functionally and capture user requirements and business needs to provide dashboards and increase efficiency for various internal stakeholders.
  • Participate in team meetings, workshops, and training sessions to develop skills and knowledge.
  • Provide training and help end-users learn how to use the dashboards.

Your Profil

  • Currently pursuing a master’s degree in business administration, computer science or related field and willing to learn about the healthcare industry
  • Excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills
  • Proficiency in Excel and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, AERA and Knowledge in SQL database and experience with cloud platforms are strong pluses.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team and passion for innovation, business development, and entrepreneurship and strong work ethic, self-starter, and team player
  • Fluent English communication, both written and spoken, with additional language skills like French are considered advantageous

What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

4135210755,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-sql-developer-at-nicoll-curtin-4135210755?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=qmNKQKSsfeCM%2FTm1sBhStw%3D%3D,Junior SQL Developer,Nicoll Curtin,"Zurich, Switzerland","We are in search of a Junior SQL Developer to join our client in Zurich.

In this role, you'll be handle client issues, analyze the SQL database to identify problems, write scripts to fix minor issues, and escalate complex problems to the development team. Over time, you will work more independently.
Fluency in German at a C1 or C2 is essential for this position.
This opportunity is perfect for you if you have 1-2 years of experience in SQL and scripting, ideally in Python, and possess familiarity with PostgreSQL and Linux.
If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

We are in search of a Junior SQL Developer to join our client in Zurich.


In this role, you'll be handle client issues, analyze the SQL database to identify problems, write scripts to fix minor issues, and escalate complex problems to the development team. Over time, you will work more independently.


Fluency in German at a C1 or C2 is essential for this position.


This opportunity is perfect for you if you have 1-2 years of experience in SQL and scripting, ideally in Python, and possess familiarity with PostgreSQL and Linux.


If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

4102338385,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-100%25-at-bank-cic-switzerland-4102338385?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=B8bXCMXp1%2BLC4hGKBmnepQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst (100%),Bank CIC |Switzerland|,"Basel, Switzerland","Sie werden Mitglied eines dynamischen Teams in der Finanz-Abteilung. Kurze und einfache Kommunikationswege, dank Nähe des Haupt-Auftraggebers, erleichtern unser Alltag. Unser kleines Team ist bestrebt, hochwertige Informationen und Wissen aus dem breiten Datenuniversum der Bank zu erzeugen. Wir erledigen alle Schritte von der Datenbeschaffung bis zur Auswertung. Innovation und Einsatz von moderne Technologien liegt uns am Herzen und KI ist der nächste Schritt.
Sie erfassen und dokumentieren die Aufträge und erstellen die technischen Anforderungen, zusammen mit dem Auftraggeber
Sie importieren Daten aus den Quellsysteme und führen Datenanalysen durch
Sie entwickeln Prozeduren im Data Warehouse für die Berechnung von KPI und liefern Berichten
Sie entwickeln Dashboard und dokumentieren Ihre Entwicklungen
Sie automatisieren wiederkehren Aufgaben, Reports oder Prozeduren
Sie prüfen die Datenqualität und Datenintegrität über alle Produkten
Sie arbeiten an Konzepte für neue Produkte und entwickeln KI-Modelle oder setzen KI Werkzeuge ein

Sie verfügen über einen Berufs- oder Studienabschluss in Informatik/Wirtschaftsinformatik und können bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Warehouse/BI eines Finanzdienstleisters vorweisen. Im Umgang mit Excel und mit relationale Datenbanken wie MS SQL Server (oder Oracle) sind Sie bestens vertraut und darüber hinaus verfügen Sie ebenso über gute Programmierkenntnisse (T-SQL). Sie haben bestenfalls Kenntnisse von QlikSense (oder PowerBI). Erfahrungen mit Jedox sowie mit der Bankenplattform Avaloq sind von Vorteil. Ebenfalls sind Erfahrungen mit Python und Data Science Aufgaben vom Vorteil für kommende Projekte. Sie zeichnen sich vor allem durch Ihr analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen aus und erledigen Ihre Arbeit mit viel Eigeninitiative, selbständig sowie lösungsorientiert. Ein hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein, grosse Lernbereitschaft sowie ein hohes Mass an Verantwortungsbewusstsein setzen wir in dieser Funktion absolut voraus. Fliessendes Deutsch und gute Französisch Kenntnisse (oder umgekehrt) runden Ihr Profil ab.

Die Möglichkeit, an innovativen Projekten mitzuwirken und Ihre Ideen einzubringen sowie ein unterstützendes und motiviertes Team, das gemeinsam grosse Ziele erreichen möchte, erwartet Sie. Bei uns wird viel Wert auf die Übernahme von Verantwortung gelegt, hierzu bieten wir viel Spielraum. Eingebettet in den Finanzkonzern der Gruppe Crédit Mutuel bieten wir Ihnen nebst attraktiven Konditionen auch Sicherheit und Kontinuität. Eine sehr gute Vorsorge und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sind weitere Pluspunkte.
Stellenantritt per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung.

4136200105,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bess-performance-analyst-at-coopers-group-ag-4136200105?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=PFStUSaSW8USQotySmLytA%3D%3D,BESS Performance Analyst,Coopers Group AG,"Solothurn, Switzerland","As a BESS Performance Analyst, you will develop the concept, thrive the implementation and later own the operative performance monitoring framework.
Based on market research and industry-best practice, you will propose and drive the rollout and implementation of the framework.
You will identify and analyze key metrics and provide insights that maximize the efficiency, performance and reliability of the future BESS asset portfolio.
This “first of its kind” role offers a unique opportunity to thrive, shape and create real impact in a dynamic environment - first BESS project will go life already by Q3/2025!
Develop an overarching and scalable performance monitoring concept for BESS
Identify and prioritize the critical performance indicators (KPI)s and relevant stakeholders
Lead project specific implementation and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
Conduct market-research on tools and industry best practice, thrive implementation of performance monitoring systems and relevant stakeholder reporting
Design early warning systems to detect and address potential performance issues
Ensure warranty compliance by monitoring system operations.
Work closely with technical and legal teams, project and asset management
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Renewable Energy, or a related field
Proven track record in energy systems performance analysis (5+ years), ideally in the field of utility scale BESS
Strong skills in data analysis (Python, SQL, Excel) and SCADA systems
In-depth understanding of BESS technology, including lithium-ion batteries, power electronics, and thermal management
Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a detail-oriented approach

column2: additional languages (German/French) are a plus

column1: Here’s what you can look forward to: You’ll be joining a modern, future-focused company that not only drives innovative projects but also places great importance on the well-being of its employees. You can expect numerous attractive benefits, including flexible working hours, opportunities for professional development, a supportive team, modern workspaces, and comprehensive health and leisure programs. This is your chance to advance your career in an inspiring environment while contributing to a sustainable vision for the future.

As a BESS Performance Analyst, you will develop the concept, thrive the implementation and later own the operative performance monitoring framework.

Based on market research and industry-best practice, you will propose and drive the rollout and implementation of the framework.

You will identify and analyze key metrics and provide insights that maximize the efficiency, performance and reliability of the future BESS asset portfolio.

This “first of its kind” role offers a unique opportunity to thrive, shape and create real impact in a dynamic environment - first BESS project will go life already by Q3/2025!


Your main responsibilities:

  • Develop an overarching and scalable performance monitoring concept for BESS
  • Identify and prioritize the critical performance indicators (KPI)s and relevant stakeholders
  • Lead project specific implementation and coordinate with internal and external stakeholders
  • Conduct market-research on tools and industry best practice, thrive implementation of performance monitoring systems and relevant stakeholder reporting
  • Design early warning systems to detect and address potential performance issues
  • Ensure warranty compliance by monitoring system operations.
  • Work closely with technical and legal teams, project and asset management


Your profile:

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Renewable Energy, or a related field
  • Proven track record in energy systems performance analysis (5+ years), ideally in the field of utility scale BESS
  • Strong skills in data analysis (Python, SQL, Excel) and SCADA systems
  • In-depth understanding of BESS technology, including lithium-ion batteries, power electronics, and thermal management
  • Exceptional problem-solving abilities and a detail-oriented approach
  • Fluency in English
column2:
additional languages (German/French) are a plus


Here’s what you can look forward to: You’ll be joining a modern, future-focused company that not only drives innovative projects but also places great importance on the well-being of its employees. You can expect numerous attractive benefits, including flexible working hours, opportunities for professional development, a supportive team, modern workspaces, and comprehensive health and leisure programs. This is your chance to advance your career in an inspiring environment while contributing to a sustainable vision for the future.

4051710462,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-energy-data-portfolio-analyst-at-totalenergies-4051710462?position=9&pageNum=2&refId=yeMmP0l4X54sbTbYDkQiaA%3D%3D&trackingId=iFQ87ESWzo2s0DTaTeJB9w%3D%3D,Senior Energy Data Portfolio Analyst,TotalEnergies,"Geneva, Geneva, Switzerland","Contexte et environnement

TotalEnergies Gas and Power is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc.). In such context, Trading helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.
In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

The development of trading around assets and the growing importance of renewables in the Company’s power ambition comes with a vital requirement for robust data management insuring accuracy and timeliness of the trading operations.

TotalEnergies is an international trading company with activity in Geneva, Houston, Paris and Singapore providing market access to the TotalEnergies affiliates focusing on Gas, Power, Emissions, LNG, and Dry Products.

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical tra des on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub in which the Product Owner of the team works with the developer to ensure the safe reception and implementation of currently 50 million data points a year into the hub with growth expected .

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeter s , is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

Senior Energy Data Analyst as part of the Trading Support department will work closely with the Product Owner of the Energy Data Hub, which is a platform that allows continuous power, and gas volumes (allocations, nominations) and prices data collect from different sources , data comparison, check and cleaning. It enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust power and gas Trading portfolio assets (such as allocations, nominations, imbalances, etc.) alongside relevant external market data (including prices) for EDM team who produces, shares quality data and advises each stakeholder to support their data requirements, and particularly, but not only, power and gas allocations, nominations, imbalances volumes and prices .

Participate in working streams to integrate new business into the EDM scope by talking to internal stakeholders on data retrieval and target operating model as it relates to Trading Support processes.
Independently researching market and product specifications as it relates to data retrieval and imbalance calculations.
Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Be a single point of contact for a specific contract(s) for reconciliation and booking into ETRM system.
Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Pro duce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.

The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable for ensuring the success of the Energy Data Hub while maintaining KPIs of product performance and providing coverage to the Energy Data Management team on reconciliations and bookings.

As product owner of the Energy Data Hub, the jobholder is responsible for ensuring that the product delivers as much value as possible for Trading i.e. simplifying business and operational processes and make them more robust (deal reconciliations and bookings, imbalances calculations, etc.), providing in one single place market and portfolio data to accelerate time-to-market for new businesses and facilitate businesses scale-up.
The Senior Energy Data Analyst is accountable to collaborate with the relevant teams to ensure best use of in house systems as it relates to data.
Educational standard required : Engineering or Finance background preferred.
2-3 years’ experienc e in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component .
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Trained in Agile and experience with IT development teams.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.

At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.
Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.
TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &

  • Support the EDM Analyst by being able to cover r econciling group affiliated contracts and b ooking of actualization of contract into ETRM system ahead of settlements.
